title: Interface fails to show parts, orders, inventory, etc.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

labels.name: triage:not-checked
labels.description: Item was not checked by the core team

body:
### Please verify that this bug has NOT been raised before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find a similar issue

### Describe the bug*

Iventree is failing to show the content in the app in general. Starting with the sections from the top-left menu, those can't load the items and the page seems empty:

![imagen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84796251/233650873-9b9bd68f-da63-48e2-b4dd-c059fd34d494.png)

This is just an example but is the same with every other section. Despite this seems like parts are there and the database is fine as you can see here, when looking for parts or anything else, it is shown just fine:

![imagen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84796251/233652100-04fa2223-2e07-4176-8794-1b3339f2abd8.png)

Also seems like its not loading part page properly as it does not show the menu in left:

![imagen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84796251/233652858-c8751e58-3205-4a5c-a8a7-71c222b27c84.png)

I also just noticed that i can't open the "about inventree" windows unless i'm the settings page.

All of this started happening after updating from 0.10.1 to 0.11.0.



### Steps to Reproduce

Update from 0.10.1 to 0.11.0

Process followed:

1. 
```powershell
docker compose run inventree-server invoke update
``` 
2. 
```powershell
docker compose down
``` 
3. 
```powershell
docker compose pull
``` 
4. 
```powershell
docker compose run inventree-server invoke update
``` 
5. 
```powershell
docker compose up -d
``` 

### Expected behaviour

It, as far as i know, should look pretty much like in 0.10.1 isn't it?

### Deployment Method

- [X] Docker
- [ ] Bare metal

### Version Information

# Version Information:
InvenTree-Version: 0.11.0
Django Version: 3.2.18
Commit Hash: 593a716
Commit Date: 2023-04-18
Database: postgresql
Debug-Mode: False
Deployed using Docker: True
Active plugins: False


### Relevant log output

_No response_

title: [CI] PIP workflow is broken

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: CI
labels.description: CI / unit testing ecosystem

body:
Discovered in https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/pull/4615

A recent [update to PIP](https://pypi.org/project/pip/23.1/) has broken our CI build:

```bash
 Collecting pip>=22.2 (from pip-tools==6.12.3->-r requirements-dev.txt (line 240))
ERROR: In --require-hashes mode, all requirements must have their versions pinned with ==. These do not:
    pip>=22.2 from https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/ae/db/a8821cdac455a1740580c92de3ed7b7f257cfdbad8b1ba8864e6abe58a08/pip-23.1-py3-none-any.whl (from pip-tools==6.12.3->-r requirements-dev.txt (line 240))

Notice:  A new release of pip is available: 22.0.4 -> 23.1
Notice:  To update, run: pip install --upgrade pip
Error: Process completed with exit code 1.
```

The `--requires-hashes` flag (which is enforced because we have hashed our pip dependencies) now appears to be more proscriptive. 

Currently the "solution" is to pin the pip version used in our CI tools to the previous version. This cannot be a "long term" solution and so we'll need to fix this properly.

title: Importing stock locations error "can't set attribute"

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: importer
labels.description: Data importing and processing

body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/discussions/4592
Originally posted by **Benjamin0001** April 8, 2023 I tried using the admin import button for stock locations but I keep getting this error ``` Line number: 1 - can't set attribute , Aisle 1, , 1, Main Warehouse, Main Warehouse/Aisle 1, 0, 0 Traceback (most recent call last): File "/root/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/import_export/resources.py", line 658, in import_row self.import_obj(instance, row, dry_run) File "/root/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/import_export/resources.py", line 512, in import_obj self.import_field(field, obj, data) File "/root/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/import_export/resources.py", line 495, in import_field field.save(obj, data, is_m2m) File "/root/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/import_export/fields.py", line 113, in save setattr(obj, attrs[-1], cleaned) AttributeError: can't set attribute ``` I made sure to leave location ID blank since they are new locations. I even once tried exporting and then re-importing the same CSV just to see what the errors were and I got the same error. Here is a sample of what I am trying to import: ``` Location ID,Location Name,Description,Parent ID,Parent Name,Location Path,Stock Items,structural ,Aisle 1,,1,Main Warehouse,Main Warehouse/Aisle 1,0,0 ,1A1,,2,Aisle 1,Main Warehouse/Aisle 1/1A1,0,0 ,1A2,,2,Aisle 1,Main Warehouse/Aisle 1/1A2,0,0 ```

So I renamed these two files (swapped 0102 a 0103) and fixed the dependencies inside the files and the migration did succeed.

body:
The following command of `wget` seems to be wrong on my Linux console:

https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/blob/d0f9d0d830b993d5d4b775818b7ff18fc5d84022/README.md?plain=1#L141

I think it should be changed to
```
wget -qO install.sh  https://get.inventree.org  && bash install.sh 
```

----

On CentOS7 Linux, `wget -Oq https://get.inventree.org` will save the downloaded file as `q`

title: "Inactive" Tag on "Part" Page Shows Wrong Tooltip

body:
### Please verify that this bug has NOT been raised before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find a similar issue

### Describe the bug*

The tooltip of the "Inactive" tag on the "Part" page shows the wrong tooltip when the mouse hovers over the "Skull-and-Bones" symbol.

![inventree_inactive_tooltip_bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/127667330/229079498-3c7e4de7-b78f-41e1-9718-2c52b623d2b3.png)


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create part
2. Set part "Inactive"
3. Hover mouse over Skull-and-Bones symbol in Inactive tag

### Expected behaviour

The tooltip explains the "Inactive" status of the part.

### Deployment Method

- [ ] Docker
- [X] Bare metal

### Version Information

# Version Information:
InvenTree-Version: 0.10.0
Django Version: 3.2.16


Database: sqlite3
Debug-Mode: False
Deployed using Docker: False
Active plugins: [{'name': 'InvenTreeBarcode', 'slug': 'inventreebarcode', 'version': '2.0.0'}, {'name': 'InvenTreeCoreNotificationsPlugin', 'slug': 'inventreecorenotificationsplugin', 'version': '1.0.0'}]


### Relevant log output

_No response_

title: Stock history fix

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: order
labels.description: Related to purchase orders / sales orders

labels.name: stock
labels.description: Related to Stock models

body:
Augments existing stock item history tracking to include "sales order" information where appropriate.

Previously, the sales order information was not included in the history when shipping items against a sales order. This was recently fixed in https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/pull/4488, but did not apply retroactively.

This is a relatively simple data migration which applies the "sales order" data to old tracking entries.

title: Report template caching

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: report
labels.description: Report generation

body:
Prevent report and label template printing from using cached templates

Fixes a very subtle bug in which a new report or label template is uploaded, but the *cached* (old) version of the template is used for printing.

Note: also features some of the refactoring work from https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/pull/4488

title: Bypass cache when displaying settings on "settings" page

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

body:
- Sometimes caching issues can cause "old" values to be stored (depends on the worker)
- Until we have a shared cache, this is a problem
- Force the settings to be re-loaded from the database when displaying
- Further improvement would be to render them via the API

Note: We should really address having a proper caching system which is shared between the background workers and the front-end workers

Ref: https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/4.1/topics/cache/

title: Editing PO line item overwrites price

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: order
labels.description: Related to purchase orders / sales orders

body:
### Please verify that this bug has NOT been raised before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find a similar issue

### Describe the bug*

Adding a PO line item takes the price from the order. This could be useful or not.

When you edit a PO line item e.g. adjusting quantity or delivery date, the dialog takes again the price from the last order. Not the price from the existing PO line item.
If the price is not corrected again (e.g. if focused on delivery date), the price in the order is overwritten with the wrong/old one


### Steps to Reproduce

Tested also on the inventree demo server
Create a PO with a component that was ordered before
Use a new price by creating the PO line item
Edit the line item e.g. adjust date
Save
Check price in line item

### Expected behaviour

Edit dialog has to use the price from the line item

### Deployment Method

- [ ] Docker
- [X] Bare metal

### Version Information

0.10.1

### Relevant log output

_No response_

title: Fix parsing dict variables from env

labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: setup
labels.description: Relates to the InvenTree setup / installation process

body: The `INVENTREE_SOCIAL_PROVIDERS` variable has been parsed as a string from the environment which resulted in an attribute error as dict was the expected variable type. To circumvent this error, parsing JSON strings as dictionary values from the environment has been added

title: Translation Fixes

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: setup
labels.description: Relates to the InvenTree setup / installation process

body:
Closes https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/4431

This PR fixes an issue relating to running translations in a production build.

Static javascript files are pre-rendered by running `invoke static` - and a copy produced for each supported language. However, there were some issues related to the requested language code not exactly matching the translated language code.

This PR serves to standardize the language code representations, and also provides a backup path if the requested javascript files are not found.

title: Cannot display correctly when browser's preferred language is Chinese

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

labels.name: user interface
labels.description: User interface

body:
### Please verify that this bug has NOT been raised before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find a similar issue

### Describe the bug*

I found this issue with my own deployment and official demo.

When using Chinese as preferred language in browser, index page and setting page shows nothing:

![Language - Chinese](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16681844/222055308-3c556c43-0aa9-4b7a-b966-980c69b4f298.png)
![Preferred language setting](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16681844/222056086-02ccaf23-e036-47a8-8a5a-a7e0bc6a09c5.png)

By changing the language to English, things went normal:

![Language - English](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16681844/222056525-34a76426-e289-47f0-8e0b-3151549bf2b7.png)
![Preferred language setting](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16681844/222056556-96f2f429-ddc5-4afb-810a-84aabd71d5ed.png)

According to the console, it is trying to load files started with `static/i18n/zh-cn.*`, while the files should be `static/i18n/zh.*`, probably caused by [settings.py](https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/blob/fdfc3e5e7eb930ca0f71d6c23157c099cc174770/InvenTree/InvenTree/settings.py#L721)? I also tried French, Greek and Korean and they don't have this issue.

![dev console](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16681844/222059552-6feaa937-5f92-4279-8e4f-6d710e375a61.png)
![static folder](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16681844/222062985-c30a96c5-a0b4-407a-b0dc-91a3bde87ec4.png)


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Use `Chinese` as browser's preferred language
2. Visit any InvenTree demo server listed in https://inventree.org/demo.html

### Expected behaviour

Index page can be display as normal

### Deployment Method

- [ ] Docker
- [ ] Bare metal

### Version Information

InvenTree demo server: 0.11.0 dev
My deployment: 0.10.1

Browser tested:
|MacOS 13.2|Android 13|
|---|---|
|Firefox 110.0|Duckduckgo 5.151.0|
|Safari 16.3||
|Edge 110.0.1587.57||

### Relevant log output

_No response_

title: Allow pricing updates when PartPricing object does not yet exist

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: pricing
labels.description: Pricing functionality

body:
- Previously if the Part did not have a referenced PartPricing object, the schedule_pricing_update method would fail
- Required a PartPricing object to actually exist (i.e. be manually created)
- This patch fixes a logic error which resulted in updating being skipped if a PartPricing instance did not already exist

(cherry picked from commit d8f82834eba0cb0ac9342a256973ebd02aa1daea)

title: Allow pricing updates when PartPricing object does not yet exist

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: pricing
labels.description: Pricing functionality

body:
- Previously if the Part did not have a referenced PartPricing object, the schedule_pricing_update method would fail
- Required a PartPricing object to actually exist (i.e. be manually created)
- This patch fixes a logic error which resulted in updating being skipped if a PartPricing instance did not already exist

Closes https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/4375

title: Pricing overview is not automatically refreshed

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: pricing
labels.description: Pricing functionality

body:
### Please verify that this bug has NOT been raised before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find a similar issue

### Describe the bug*

When creating a new stock item the price is not automatically refreshed and under prcing the overview reports **Price range data is not available for this part.**

This happens with about 75% of the entries. In a few  cases after entering the stock the price is automatically updated and you dont have to click refresh.

![Screenshot from 2023-02-20 08-12-57](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1429043/220050304-aeecfa55-e85e-441e-826a-de2c9f2a9f7f.png)

The price range for the part is also not updated until you click refresh.
![Screenshot from 2023-02-20 08-12-47](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1429043/220050484-10d51f3e-6b97-4104-b175-af247fbc3a71.png)

![Screenshot from 2023-02-20 08-12-10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1429043/220052102-965e744f-f7c8-4223-9c54-9bc581208107.png)


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create new part 
      Name: test_part1
      Description: test
2. On the part click Stock
3. Create new stock item 
     Qty: 100
     Price 1.00
4. Click back to the part you created.
5. Click on Pricing - the pricing overview  says not available. 
6.  If you view the listing of parts the price range is also at - (Even though the stock value is correct)

To update the pricing you need to click on refresh. This issue happens about 75% of the times. Sometimes after entering the stock the price is automatically refreshed. 

### Expected behaviour

Would expect price to automatically refresh without having to go back to each part and click refresh. I thought this might happen as a scheduled job but have left it 12 hours and still no update. 

### Deployment Method

- [ ] Docker
- [X] Bare metal

### Version Information

# Version Information:
InvenTree-Version: 0.11.0 dev
Django Version: 3.2.16
Commit Hash: e78161bd0
Commit Date: 18/02/2023
Database: mysql
Debug-Mode: True
Deployed using Docker: False
Active plugins: False


### Relevant log output

```shell
I can't find any issues which shows why this is occuring.
```

title: Bug fix for purchase order pricing

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: pricing
labels.description: Pricing functionality

body:
When receiving line items from a purchase order which has a custom pack size, unit purchase pricing was not being calculated correctly.

This PR provides a simple fix, and unit testing to ensure that it is handled correctly.

Additionally, a data migration is added to correct any miscalculations in the database

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: part
labels.description: Related to Part models

body:
### Please verify that this bug has NOT been raised before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find a similar issue

### Describe the bug*

I get a server error when I try to duplicate a part in case the category has parameter templates and the part has pemplates and both switches are on. 

### Steps to Reproduce

Add part category parameter template to a category (e.g. CAP) in the admin interface (e.g. Capacitance)
Select a part in the normal site from that category that already has the parameter Capacitance
Select part duplicate
Fill name IPN and description with proper values
Leave all switches in their default position specially: Copy Category Parameters ON and Copy Parameters ON
Duplicate fill fail with message 
An error occurred in the current transaction. You can't execute queries until the end of the 'atomic' block.


### Expected behaviour

Duplicate should work.
Somehow it is logical that this cannot work. We need to set a priority here. I would expect that the Copy Category Parameters is ignored in that case, or warning please switch OFF. 

### Deployment Method

- [ ] Docker
- [X] Bare metal

title: Backup task creates way too many, too often and redundant backups

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

labels.name: setup
labels.description: Relates to the InvenTree setup / installation process

body:
### Please verify that this bug has NOT been raised before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find a similar issue

### Describe the bug*

1) Backup creates backups every 2 minutes.
2) Database backups retain last 10 backups (limited by number of files, not by time). So if Inventree generates 10 backups in a row, your day old backups are gone. 
Media file backups are removed after 4 days. Right now, Inventree backups take up about 541 GB and 2732 files on disk due to these bugs for me. For now, I'll make cron script to remove these files, however each day still consumes about 144 GB...
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29711626/216028746-46af3b5a-3dd0-4767-bc07-62e847ac62d6.png)

2) If multiple workers are allowed, each worker makes its own backup concurrently, thus making redundant and unneeded backups. This leads even to files with identical names and huge computational demands on the server.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29711626/216027715-181c4c56-8ed9-4370-94fb-6738a696a325.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29711626/216030136-21d25ce8-0905-4a0b-a8cd-32da679494a9.png)


### Steps to Reproduce

Start docker Inventree 0.9.2 and observe behaviour of backup.

### Expected behaviour

Backups shouldn't be run every 2 minutes.
Backup period should be user configurable.
Backup retention should be consistent - either number of files or number of days (I prefer days).
Backup retention should include total size of backups.
Only one worker should be tasked with creating backup, not all of them.

### Deployment Method

- [X] Docker
- [ ] Bare metal

### Version Information

0.9.2

### Relevant log output

_No response_

title: Cannot open new PO when changing pattern

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.description: This is a question

body:
### Please verify that this bug has NOT been raised before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find a similar issue

### Describe the bug*

I had used ``PO-{date}-{ref:04d}`` -- not realizing this was going to give the entire datetime.

I made a PO with this -- which I later renamed to ``PO-0007``

I then changed it to what I wanted it to be -- which is ``PO-{ref:05d}{date:%y}{date:%m}``

And when I try to create a new PO it populates correctly as -- ``PO-000082301`` but when I go to submit the PO I get the following error: 

``redefinition of group name 'date' as group 3; was group 2 at position 33``

It seems the backend is choking on changing the pattern when including multiple ``{date}`` calls, even if they aren't identical (like ``{date}`` vs ``{date:%y} {date:%m}``).  

I suppose this could generalize to any django call that can have sub-elements triggered by ``%`` but have not tested as such.





### Steps to Reproduce

I was able to recreate the issue on my Docker server and the Inventree Demo server with Admin access:

3. Set PO reference with a ``{date}`` element (i.e. in position 2 -- ``PO-{ref:04d}{date}``)
4. Open a PO
5. submit PO
6. Now set PO Reference with TWO ``{date}`` elements -- like ``PO-{ref:04d}{date}{date}``)
7. Kick dirt...

### Expected behaviour

Changing from
``PO-{date}{ref:04d}``
to 
``PO-{ref:04d}{date:%y}{date:%m}``

Should be allowed and the PO pattern validation engine should treat these sub-elements as distinct.

### Deployment Method

- [X] Docker
- [ ] Bare metal

title: [BUG] Increase worker-timeout to account for install times

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: setup
labels.description: Relates to the InvenTree setup / installation process

body:
I might have another instance of the same worker-timeout-loop during startup to add to the issue. My docker production installation at InvenTree:latest is running on a Raspberry Pi 3B+.
The loop occured after I had added the `inventree-brother-plugin` to `plugins.txt` - the initial plugin installation took too long during startup so that the worker processes timed out and were constantly restartet.

My "solution" was to increase the gunicorn timeout variable in the `.env` file to
```
# Options for gunicorn server
INVENTREE_GUNICORN_TIMEOUT=60
```
but maybe actions like pip installs should somehow generally not count against the worker timeout? (I'm not sure about the technical internals on this one at the moment...)

_Originally posted by @simonkuehling in https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/4180#issuecomment-1410348943_

body: This started as a simple PR to fix https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/4266 However there were some issues which cropped up, so fixing those also. The main thrust of this PR is bringing the extra "part creation" fields into the DRF serializer, rather than hacking them in manually. This has multiple advantages: - Exposes the fields to the API auto-doc - Runs validators on the fields - Exposes the fields to the self-describing metadata framework ------------ - Fixes https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/4266 - Fixes https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/4279

title: API Company.create() does not accept remote_image even though listed in the API

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: Duplicate of another issue or PR

body:
### Please verify that this bug has NOT been raised before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find a similar issue

### Describe the bug*

The InvenTree 0.9.2 /api-doc page lists `remote_image` as one of the parameters of the Company create API.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34971/215278824-82dbfc19-aca6-493b-a0a8-51209835c70b.png)

However, when I try to create a company with following data:
```
{'name': 'DigiKey', 'website': 'https://www.digikey.de/', 'remote_image': 'https://logodix.com/logo/1667872.jpg', 'description': '', 'is_manufacturer': False, 'is_supplier': True, 'is_customer': False, 'currency': 'EUR'}
```
I receive the following error response:
```
requests.exceptions.HTTPError: {'detail': 'Error occurred during API request', 'url': 'https://inventree-test.mydomain.com/api/company/', 'method': 'POST', 'status_code': 500, 'body': '{"error":"TypeError","error_class":"<class \'TypeError\'>","detail":"Error details can be found in the admin panel","path":"/api/company/","status_code":500}', 'headers': {'AUTHORIZATION': 'Token 6daae3817756e9c1a3603b14d9582e61f50db388'}, 'params': {'format': 'json'}, 'data': {'name': 'DigiKey', 'website': 'https://www.digikey.de/', 'remote_image': 'https://logodix.com/logo/1667872.jpg', 'description': '', 'is_manufacturer': False, 'is_supplier': True, 'is_customer': False, 'currency': 'EUR'}}
```

with the following stack trace in the admin panel:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):

File "/root/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/rest_framework/views.py", line 506, in dispatch
response = handler(request, *args, **kwargs)

File "/root/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/rest_framework/generics.py", line 242, in post
return self.create(request, *args, **kwargs)

File "/home/inventree/InvenTree/InvenTree/mixins.py", line 21, in create
serializer.is_valid(raise_exception=True)

File "/root/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/rest_framework/serializers.py", line 227, in is_valid
self._validated_data = self.run_validation(self.initial_data)

File "/home/inventree/InvenTree/InvenTree/serializers.py", line 181, in run_validation
instance = self.Meta.model(**data)

File "/root/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/django/db/models/base.py", line 503, in __init__
raise TypeError("%s() got an unexpected keyword argument '%s'" % (cls.__name__, kwarg))

TypeError: Company() got an unexpected keyword argument 'remote_image'
```

Therefore, either the documentation is not generated correctly (i.e. `remote_image` should not actually be a parameter for the Company.create() function or the create() code does not process remote_image correctly.

### Steps to Reproduce

Run the following Python script with correct credentials:

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python3
from inventree.api import InvenTreeAPI
from inventree.company import Company

api = InvenTreeAPI("https://inventree-test.mydomain.com", username="admin", password="abc123abc")

Company.create(api, {"name": "DigiKey",
                     "currency": "EUR",
                     "remote_image": "https://logodix.com/logo/1667872.jpg"})
```

### Expected behaviour

A company with the given image URL is created.

### Deployment Method

- [X] Docker
- [ ] Bare metal

### Version Information

0.9.2

### Relevant log output

_No response_

title: Can't access Assembled item "Bill of Materials"

labels.name: bug

body:
### Please verify that this bug has NOT been raised before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find a similar issue

### Describe the bug*

When navigating to "assembled item", the Left Menu containing "Bill of Materials" is missing. I don't see any way to view/edit bill of materials.

This first occurred when updated from previously installed version to latest version 0.9.2. Did I miss a major feature/GUI update?

Inventree was updated with the following steps:
1. docker-compose down
2. docker-compose pull
3. docker-compose run inventree-server invoke update
4. docker-compose up -d

Please see 
1. "View_Parts" - All items in view are assembled items
2. "View_ASM" - No menu on the left to navigate assembled item options

![View_Parts](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4116718/214796175-070feda4-bba0-4b2c-87be-0e7f4f04487a.png)
![View_ASM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4116718/214796185-5c752f69-5446-4cef-b03a-9466e626f91a.png)


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to "Parts"
2. Go to "Subcategories"
3. Select Sub category containing Assemblies
4. Change view from "Sub Categories" to "Parts" right below "Sub Categories"
5. Select and open any part that indicates that it is an "Assembled Item" with the wrench icon
6. The left menu that should contain "Bill of Materials" does not exist

### Expected behaviour

When opening an assembled item, the menu on the left should appear and have the option to select "Bill of Materials", you should then be able to view and edit the opened assembly.

### Deployment Method

- [ ] Bare metal

title: [BUG] :checkered_flag: Plugin scheduled tasks: Schedule not updated

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: plugin
labels.description: Plugin ecosystem

body:
### Please verify that this bug has NOT been raised before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find similar issue

### Describe the bug*

The scheduling time of a task is not updated after change in the source code. 

### Steps to Reproduce

I enabled the scheduled tasks plugin from samples 
I did some slight modification to the code:
```python

def print_hello():
    now = datetime.now()
    print(now, ": Hello")  # pragma: no cover


def print_world():
    now = datetime.now()
    print(now,": World")  # pragma: no cover

class ScheduledTaskPlugin(ScheduleMixin, SettingsMixin, InvenTreePlugin):

    NAME = "ScheduledTasksPlugin"
    SLUG = "schedule"
    TITLE = "Scheduled Tasks"

    SCHEDULED_TASKS = {
          'hello': {
            'func': 'plugin.samples.integration.scheduled_task.print_hello',
            'schedule': 'I',
            'minutes': 5,
        },
        'world': {
            'func': 'plugin.samples.integration.scheduled_task.print_world',
            'schedule': 'H',
        },
    }
```
Here is what I get from the log after sorting a bit.

2023-01-20 22:50 : World
2023-01-20 23:51 : World
2023-01-21 00:50 : World
2023-01-21 01:50 : World
2023-01-21 02:50 : World
2023-01-21 04:51 : World
2023-01-21 05:50 : World
2023-01-21 06:51 : World

2023-01-20 22:50 : Hello
2023-01-20 23:36 : Hello
2023-01-21 00:20 : Hello
2023-01-21 01:05 : Hello
2023-01-21 01:50 : Hello
2023-01-21 02:36 : Hello
2023-01-21 03:20 : Hello

So Hello is executed every 45 minutes instead of five. I took a look at the database and found the 45:

![schedule](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10836099/213859688-73452d44-bedc-4049-81d2-f9df3bce615a.png)

The problem seems to be in ../plugin/base/integration/mixins.py
```python
  def register_tasks(self):
        """Register the tasks with the database."""
        try:
            from django_q.models import Schedule

            for key, task in self.scheduled_tasks.items():

                task_name = self.get_task_name(key)

                if Schedule.objects.filter(name=task_name).exists():
                    # Scheduled task already exists - continue!
                    continue  # pragma: no cover

                logger.info(f"Adding scheduled task '{task_name}'")

                func_name = task['func'].strip()

```
As I do not see the log message I think create is not executed because it already exists. Or do I miss something?

Michael

### Expected behavior

I would expect the scheduling times to change when I edit the source of the plugin.

### Deployment Method

- [ ] Docker
- [X] Bare metal

### Version Information

InvenTree Version 	[0.10.0 dev](https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/releases)
Development Version
	Commit Hash	4bfc1f742
	Commit Date	2023-01-11

### Relevant log output

```shell
please see above
```

labels.name: bug

body:
### Please verify that this bug has NOT been raised before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find similar issue

### Describe the bug*

This is a followup for #4228.

When a user is a member of more than one group, stock items owned by one of these groups are read-only despite the group having VACD rights on stock items.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create two groups with VACD rights on stock items.
2. Add a normal (non-admin) user account to both groups.
3. Have a stock item being owned by one of these groups.
4. Notice how the stock item is read-only when logged in as said user.

### UPDATE 2022-01-20 ###

After further investigation it seems stock item ownership is broken in general. Even when the stock item is owned by the current user it appears read-only.

### Expected behavior

The stock item is modifiable by the user.

### Deployment Method

- [ ] Docker
- [X] Bare metal

body:
### Please verify that this bug has NOT been raised before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find similar issue

### Describe the bug*

When adding line items with different currencies, the total price calculated in the line items overview does not take into account different currencies per line.

This happens in Purchase and in Sales orders. 10 yen are only about 8 cents - 20 USD is way off the correct value.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1314853/211769348-c9c537dd-4ffb-4429-a619-0a13a6aa76b5.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1314853/211770368-3a091be9-27ea-4654-83ae-5114e360f0a9.png)

These were both created on the demo server. The total cost, calculated at the top of the order, is correct in both cases (10.08 USD)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create sales|purchase order
2. Add line items with different currencies
3. Check bottom of table summary - find wrong sum

### Expected behavior

One could argue that it makes no sense to use different currencies for each line item. I was trying to use this in a sales order to calculate a total cost of an idea, with parts purchased from different vendors, in different countries.

Regardless of which, it is currently possible to do this, and the sum is wrong. Something must be changed. Options:

1. Make the calculation take into account the currencies, as with the total cost.
2. Remove the sum from the table - better no info than wrong info, possibly on if different currencies available.
3. Make it impossible to use different currencies in line items in an order. This would require setting a currency for an order, and sticking to that.

### Deployment Method

- [X] Docker
- [ ] Bare metal

### Version Information

# Version Information:
InvenTree-Version: 0.10.0 dev
Django Version: 3.2.16
Commit Hash: e730b5c
Commit Date: 2023-01-10
Database: postgresql
Debug-Mode: False
Deployed using Docker: True
Active plugins: False

_No response_

title: SSO SignUp with Microsoft Azure AD | Bug/Issue

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

labels.name: setup
labels.description: Relates to the InvenTree setup / installation process

body:
### Please verify that this bug has NOT been raised before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find similar issue

### Describe the bug*

We just did the configuration to accept Azure AD Single Sign On, the way it works is that we basically configured an Azure AD Security Group to the Azure AD Authentication for Inventree's Single Sign on.
When we want to allow Login to Inventree we first add the User in the Azure AD Security Group and that's pretty much it.

So let us assume that a user "test@domain.com" was just added as a Member to the Security Group that is bound to the Group on Azure AD.

The User goes to Inventree.domain.com and clicks on 'Microsoft Graph' under 'or use SSO'.
User is the prompted with a Microsoft Login Screen.
The User Authenticates using Microsoft Credentials.
User gets the filled-in Inventree Sign up form.
User clicks on Sign Up
User is Presented with an Internal Server Error (As per the attached screenshot)

How we are currently fixing the situation and actually allowing the user to sign in:
User Closes the Internal Server Error Tab.
Goes back to the Inventree.domain.com 
Clicks on 'Microsoft Graph' under 'or use SSO'
Microsoft Authentication is Done
User is able to Login

### Steps to Reproduce

1. The User goes to Inventree.domain.com and clicks on 'Microsoft Graph' under 'or use SSO'.
2. User is the prompted with a Microsoft Login Screen.
3. The User Authenticates using Microsoft Credentials.
4. User gets the filled-in Inventree Sign up form.
5. User clicks on Sign Up
6. User is Presented with an Internal Server Error (As per the attached screenshot)
![Error Inventree Sign Up SSO](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/122104842/211037058-a2476f2e-c6ac-4017-ac0f-b35ea1499e9a.png)


### Expected behavior

Instead of Internal Server Error, user should get a screen saying "SSO Sign-up has been Successful" and gets redirected to the index page.

### Deployment Method

- [X] Docker
- [X] Bare metal

### Version Information

InvenTree-Version: 0.9.0 dev
Django Version: 3.2.15


Database: sqlite3
Debug-Mode: False
Deployed using Docker: False
Active plugins: []

body:
Variant BOM Pricing pie chart does not seem to be including inherited parts. Template part: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/305681/210823260-81e4804a-dc78-4b27-87ef-4dfa53349cd3.png) Variant part: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/305681/210823690-77903e49-5004-4e5a-bbd3-40841d2385e7.png) I expected pie chart for the Variant part to also include the inherited parts, but it only appears to include the non-inherited parts. Note that the BOM Pricing is calculated correctly, but the pie chart is not including the inherited parts for display. Here's the version info for the Inventree installation (via Docker image). ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/305681/210822952-6fef017e-3dcd-4a33-b783-8c73a327c76b.png) # Version Information: InvenTree-Version: 0.8.4 Django Version: 3.2.15 Commit Hash: ca1fbf9 Commit Date: 2022-10-20 Database: mysql Debug-Mode: False Deployed using Docker: True ### Discussed in https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/discussions/4156
Originally posted by **Geekly** January 5, 2023 I'm trying to view pricing for variant BOMs. I'm referring specifically to the pie chart that shows the contribution of each part in a BOM to the total price. The total under Pricing Information seems correct, it's just the pie chart that's incomplete. Template Part BOM - Part A (Inherited) - Part B The BOM Pricing pie chart for the Template Part is complete and correct. Both parts show up in the pie chart with prices. Variant 1 (based on Template Part) - Part A (Inherited) - Part C The BOM Pricing pie chart for Variant 1 is incomplete. Only the Part C shows up in the pie chart and non of the inherited parts. Obviously we want to see all of the parts. Does anyone have suggestions about what I could be doing wrong? Is this the right place for this post? Thanks very much.

body:
### Please verify that this bug has NOT been raised before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find similar issue

### Describe the bug*

I have been running InvenTree without upgrading now since September (commit 5a08ef908). I liked the changes you have done recently for pricing why I upgraded to the latest master yesterday (commit e4a904e1b) yesterday but I cannot figure out how to get the pricing cache populated.

I would assume it's the task `part.tasks.check_missing_pricing` that should populate the cache and I can see in the Admin panel that it has been running. I have also set the next run a few minutes in the future several times and the task is running successfully each time. But filtering parts with "has pricing = true" I get no returns and obviously most pricing fields are empty, I also checked the database and the table `part_partpricing` is empty,

I have reverted to the old version and done the upgrade again with same result.

Any suggestions what I'm missing?

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Upgrade from the old release
2. invoke update
3. Check that `part.tasks.check_missing_pricing` has been running

Pricing cache to be populated

I've update my test/dev inventree instance, and I've got urls referecing issues.

(see stack trace below and plugin code at [StockTrackPanel](https://github.com/Bbillyben/StockTrackPanel_plugin/blob/main/StockTrackPanel.py) )


As Element of debugging : 

the method `setup_urls` is called during server start, and paths seems well formed.
the property `urlpatterns` is not called at all. 

When I print in `plugin.urls.get_plugin_urls ` the plugins referenced in `registry.plugins.values`:
```

    urls = []

    for plugin in registry.plugins.values():
        print("####### :"+str(plugin.slug))
        if plugin.mixin_enabled('urls'):
            print(      "urls :"+str(plugin.urlpatterns))
            urls.append(plugin.urlpatterns)

    return re_path(f'^{PLUGIN_BASE}/', include((urls, 'plugin')))
```
I only trace `builtin` plugins:

> ####### :corenotificationsplugin


and after that, is called the `setup_urls` from my plugin without any error (not in the loop in `get_plugin_urls`, somewhere else, but I do not know where...)

and the output from `get_plugin_urls `become:

```
get_plugin_urls
####### :inventreebarcode

urls :<URLResolver <URLPattern list> (sample:sample) '^sample/'>
####### :stocktrack
[StockTrackPanel]-urlpatterns
urls :<URLResolver <URLPattern list> (stocktrack:stocktrack) '^stocktrack/'>
```
And urls are well referenced !!

I'm trying to search in plugin.registry as I can spot some recent commits for it.

If I comment all about urls in the code (path and elements for panel tempalte context), all works without error.

It works on my 'semi-prod' version : 
> InvenTree-Version: 0.9.0 dev
> Django Version: 3.2.15
> Commit Hash: fbc9925
> Commit Date: 07/10/2022




### Steps to Reproduce

Don't really know. I haven't tried with simple URLsmixin.

reference the url as it did before.

![2022-12-12 13_50_30-InvenTree _ Purchase Order](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3959229/207050016-3680c020-b85d-4e9e-aaa4-3217f1f01c38.png)

title: [FR] 1D Barcode Search

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: barcode
labels.description: Barcode scanning and integration

body:
### Please verify that this feature request has NOT been suggested before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find similar feature request

### Problem statement

Search for Parts by scanning a 1D barcode (e.g. a GS1 GTIN barcode in UPC and/or EAN format).

Currently the browser barcode scanner doesn't seem to detect 1D barcodes, while the android app scanner does.
Additionally, the app scanner can read existing label information encoded as a 1D barcode (e.g. `{"part":1}` encoded as a code-128 barcode).

I've tried looking through the interface and documentation for the appropriate place to designate a barcode for a part, but there doesn't seem to be one available.

### Suggested solution

Upgrade existing barcode and/or search functions to search for parts which have a designated barcode value.
Additionally, the browser barcode scanner will need 1D barcode recognition to be implemented if not already available.

Implementing this feature may require the Part model to be updated with a `barcode` field.

As this feature deviates from electrical components and leads toward general inventory management, it may make sense to add an option to the global barcode settings menu to make it optional.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Generic barcode searching could also be added to the normal search bar (i.e. not the barcode search menu) so any information encoded as a barcode could be used as a search input.

### Examples of other systems

_No response_

### Do you want to develop this?

- [ ] I want to develop this.

body: - To determine if worker is running, look for *any* successful task, not just heartbeat - Heartbeat rate increased to 5 minute intervals - Small adjustments to django_q settings Closes https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/3921

title: [Bug] Background Worker Issues

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

body:
I have been trying to chase down a particularly difficult bug for a while now, and finally think I have it sorted out.

### Problem Description

If the [background worker](https://django-q.readthedocs.io/) processes too many tasks in a short space of time, subsequent tasks are handled "synchronously" (by the foreground worker / web-server) until the next scheduled "heartbeat" task. Essentially the background worker stops responding to new queued tasks for ~15 minutes.

#### Save Limit

The django-q configuration has a [save_limit](https://django-q.readthedocs.io/en/latest/configure.html#save-limit) parameter with a default value of 250. This means that once 250 "successful tasks" are stored in the database, any older successful tasks are deleted

#### Background Worker Monitoring

When the web-server tries to schedule a new background task, it first checks to see if the background worker is running. We use the "heartbeat" task to run periodically, and then we can simply see if that task has been run (within a certain time window) to determine if the worker is actually running.

However if lots of other successful tasks run, the 250 task limit overflows and the successful "heartbeat" tasks are dropped. Thus the frontend "thinks" that the worker is down (but it really isn't)

#### Bandaid Solution

The "heartbeat" task idea is already a bandaid solution, as the built-in monitoring functionality for django-q does not work properly in our situation. I have been [trying to work this out for a while](https://github.com/Koed00/django-q/issues/516) - I think it is because the django cache is not shared between processes

#### Caching

The realisation about caching not being shared raises another issue. We make use of cache to store things such as settings (user / global / plugin) - now there is a possibility that the worker and server processes may be 'out of sync' if their caches have different values! Need to look into this.

title: Floating point API bug

labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: api
labels.description: Relates to the API

body: Some floating point values do not respect precision when sent via the API. e.g. `1.1` -> `1.100000000000000088817841970012523233890533447265625` Closes https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/3872

title: Python API: setInternalPrice breaks on floats

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: api
labels.description: Relates to the API

body:
### Please verify that this bug has NOT been raised before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find similar issue

### Describe the bug*

`some_part.setInternalPrice(1, 1.0)` works fine (passing an integer value), but `some_part.setInternalPrice(1, 1.1)` (passing an actual float) returns:

    requests.exceptions.HTTPError: {'detail': 'Error occurred during API request', 'url': 'http://192.168.178.17:1337/api/part/internal-price/', 'method': 'POST', 'status_code': 400, 'body': '{"price":["Ensure that there are no more than 19 digits in total."]}', 'headers': {'AUTHORIZATION': 'Token 26df295ad7522c38f3226c5e7a62f6c1ce26b5ee'}, 'params': {'format': 'json'}, 'data': {'part': 60, 'quantity': 1, 'price': 1.1}}

I noticed that the `test_set_price` in https://github.com/inventree/inventree-python/blob/master/test/test_part.py tests with value 1.0, maybe it breaks with 1.1 ?

### Steps to Reproduce

See description

### Expected behavior

Internal price is set

title: Subcategories view is unstable if switching between flat and tree view until page is reloaded

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: user interface
labels.description: User interface

labels.name: starter
labels.description: Good issue for a developer new to the project

body:
### Please verify that this bug has NOT been raised before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find similar issue

### Describe the bug*

Switching between Display as list and Display as tree view does not work correctly and requires reloading the page to work properly.
Tested on Parts-Subcategories and Stock-sublocations.
Tested both on 0.8.3 official docker image and 0.9.0 dev version from Inventree demo.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open Inventree demo. Open the Parts-Subcategories view.
2. Switch to Display as list. Press F5.
3. Switch to Display as tree view. The list looks the same as it does not show subcategories. (Note - by default, no filters shall be applied.)
4. Press F5. Now, the tree view correctly shows up as tree.
5. Switch back to Display as list. The list still lists the tree view, just as a "flat" display with no indentation and any hints on the tree structure.
6. Press F5. Now, the list is correctly shown and no subcategories are shown.
7. Now, apply filter "Include subcategories = true". Switch to Display as tree view. All entries are now indented by the same amount and the drop-down arrows are not shown, thus it does not look like tree view.

### Expected behavior

The page could be reloaded when switching view methods.
Also, the whole display area could reload.

### Deployment Method

- [X] Docker
- [ ] Bare metal

### Version Information

# Version Information:
InvenTree-Version: 0.8.3
Django Version: 3.2.15
Commit Hash: f9d2b14
Commit Date: 2022-09-23
Database: postgresql
Debug-Mode: False
Deployed using Docker: True


### Relevant log output

_No response_

Thanks again @SchrodingersGat for the barcode refactoring, from my view it's a really great addition !

title: [Bug] Selecting and deleting multiple BOM items does not delete multiple items.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

body:
### Please verify that this bug has NOT been raised before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find similar issue

### Describe the bug*

I noticed that when I select(using checkbox) multiple BOM items and click "delete", I will get a "Delete selected BOM items?" prompt but only one of the selected items will be listed in the prompt and only one of them will be deleted.

Furthermore, when clicking the "Tools" button above the BOM and then clicking "Delete items", nothing happens.

### Steps to Reproduce

Issue A:
1. Browse a BOM
2. Select >1 items with the checkboxes
3. Click the red "delete" button on the right side of the BOM item
4. Prompt displays only one item and only one item will be deleted

Issue B:
1. Browse a BOM
2. Select 1 or more items with the checkboxes
3. Click "Tools" menu above the BOM, click "Delete items"

### Expected behavior

When selecting one or more items using the checkboxes, it is expected that they will all be deleted

When clicking the Tools-Delete Items menu, it is expected that items will be deleted. 

### Deployment Method

- [X] Docker
- [ ] Bare metal

### Version Information

0.8.3

### Relevant log output

_No response_

title: Some part parameters not shown when sorting ascending

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: part
labels.description: Related to Part models

body:
### Please verify that this bug has NOT been raised before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find similar issue

### Describe the bug*

I have imported parameters for a group of parts, and the parameters all display correctly when the parts are sorted by Part Name:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3541291/191485596-8fed75cb-26a2-4731-a9b6-a2685ae8d604.png)

If I click the column header 'Resistance' to sort the parts, it initially sorts them in descending order and they display correctly:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3541291/191485817-c27fe6de-1886-4242-ba4c-25e422e6e9a7.png)

However, if I click the header again to change the sort direction to ascending, a large number of parameter values are replaced by a hyphen:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3541291/191488954-bcbdfd09-00c8-4d51-905e-7f0898f17459.png)

This issue occurs regardless of which parts or which parameters I am looking at.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to Parts
2. Click Subcategories and select a subcategory
3. Click Parameters
4. Click a column header in the table of parameters to sort that column

### Expected behavior

The sort function should work correctly regrdless of the sort order.

### Deployment Method

- [X] Docker
- [ ] Bare metal

title: Plugin API refactor

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: This is an suggested enhancement or new feature

labels.name: plugin
labels.description: Plugin ecosystem

labels.name: breaking
labels.description: Indicates a major update or change which breaks compatibility

body: This PR: - includes a small refactor: Moves the checks if a plugin ref is valid into a separate function - adds a check if the requested plugin is active - fixes the lookup for settings. Currently, we are looking at `SETTINGS` - which refers to the static definition of settings. A plugin can also define settings at runtime so we need to lookup `settings`.

title: Stock items get stuck in Inventree stable

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

labels.name: stock
labels.description: Related to Stock models

body:
### Please verify that this bug has NOT been raised before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find similar issue

### Describe the bug*

Stock items started to get stuck and partially noninteractive for me. I can't add/remove/count some stock items. To make other stock items non-interactive, all I need to do is edit its batch code in any way. It seems as if the function which checks which items are selected, omits some items for some reason. See pictures for reference.
By looking into admin part, I can't see any difference between normal and stuck stock items.
Restarting the Inventree server / worker / database has no effect on this. InvenTree itself says it is healthy.
Interestingly, I can split part of the stuck stock item to the same location and then delete it, so I can count the stock in a very dirty way. Both the new split item and the old one are still in the stuck state.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29711626/186175508-20b30f6f-d316-498e-ac15-afcb2eccfbc2.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29711626/186175560-3b7dc17d-5fa6-4549-9e4b-3e0d18a52601.png)


### Steps to Reproduce

Try counting stock of some item. It should work.
Edit batch code of the item.
Try counting / adding / removing the stock item again. It will look as if Inventree can't see the item for this operation and refuses to perform the operation.

### Expected behavior

Inventree shouldn't lock up items - I have to remove existing stock items and create them again in order to be able to manipulate them.

### Deployment Method

- [X] Docker
- [ ] Bare metal

### Version Information

# Version Information:
InvenTree-Version: 0.7.7
Django Version: 3.2.13


Database: postgresql
Debug-Mode: False
Deployed using Docker: True


### Relevant log output

_No response_

body: Remove ASCII and unicode control characters from search input text. Copying and pasting text to search with may include hidden control characters which can either: - Cause incorrect / unexpected search results - Throw errors if the database collation does not allow extended unicode characters A simple fix here is to strip such characters out from the search text

title: Decimal point in label template

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: report
labels.description: Report generation

body:
### Please verify that this bug has NOT been raised before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find similar issue

### Describe the bug*

Part templates are not rendered correctly in size due to localized interpolation of `width` and `height` in https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/blob/da715d738163f09afb3fbdf897a7ea1b3ceae6ab/InvenTree/label/templates/label/label_base.html#L6-L11 because in https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/blob/da715d738163f09afb3fbdf897a7ea1b3ceae6ab/InvenTree/label/models.py#L178-L179 `width` and `height` are passed in as floats which Django templating handles localized and interpolates with `,` instead of `.` as we can see in the weazyprint error that height and width are invalid values:
```
Ignored `width: 50,1mm` at 36:5, invalid value.
Ignored `left: 50,1mm` at 43:5, invalid value.
```

### Steps to Reproduce

1. have German as language (I don't know where to set this)
2. Try to print label to pdf
3. See errors in console and invalid size of pdf

### Expected behavior

PDF should be in the size like selected for the template.

### Deployment Method

- [X] Docker
- [ ] Bare metal

### Version Information

```

InvenTree-Version: 0.9.0 dev
Django Version: 3.2.15
Commit Hash: ebdb1c707
Commit Date: 2022-08-18
Database: sqlite3
Debug-Mode: True
Deployed using Docker: False
Active plugins: [{'name': 'inventree_bulk', 'slug': 'bulkaction', 'version': '0.1'}, {'name': 'CupsLabels', 'slug': 'cups', 'version': '0.1.0'}]
```

labels.name: bug

body:
### Please verify that this bug has NOT been raised before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find similar issue

### Describe the bug*

When printing multiple labels to a PDF, the text includes spacing. When printing a single PDF, this does not occur.

Example with the built-in part label template `Barcode Part Label - Simple part label with Code128 barcode`:
One label created:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1314853/184400791-5dba0cf4-28e1-43ac-8b8f-38f926eb9124.png)

Two labels created:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1314853/184400846-7de74142-ea1b-4f05-aaca-97671625a3bc.png)


Example with a stock item template I made. These use the same template, but in one I call:

Output with one single label:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1314853/184399658-e9f4caad-ca77-44c4-a08a-2510f4e4f8bb.png)

Output with multiple labels:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1314853/184399778-4381fa89-da76-43d8-9c4b-ea4f8723920d.png)

The fact that some lines are missing is not a problem, that is due to the template. However, where is the spacing from?

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Print label with text for one part.
2. Print label with text for several parts at once.
3. Compare, and see that it looks weird in one case.

### Expected behavior

The output should look the same regardless of whether I create multiple labels at once or not.

body:
### Please verify that this bug has NOT been raised before.

- [X] I checked and didn't find similar issue

### Describe the bug*

The flag "Accept Incomplete" for Build Orders seems not to work if there are no outputs - it does work when there is at least 1 output, however.

This is true for the API and the GUI. In the API, the POST data is:
```
{
    "accept_overallocated": false,
    "accept_unallocated": false,
    "accept_incomplete": true
}
```
error returned is the following:
```
{
    "non_field_errors": [
        "No build outputs have been created for this build order"
    ]
}
```

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Choose a Build Order which has zero completed outputs.
2. Set "Accept Incomplete" flag to true in Build Order complete window / post this flag as true
3. See the error:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1314853/183951952-75a32fa2-da40-46b0-9538-bd4eba27a52b.png)

Or in the API, error returned is the following:
```
{
    "non_field_errors": [
        "No build outputs have been created for this build order"
    ]
}
```

### Expected behavior

The flag is "accept incomplete", so I do not see a large difference between zero and 1 outputs.

title: [BUG] upgrade fails due to incompatibility of config.yaml in 0.7.X and 0.8.X

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

body:
**Describe the bug**

Previously I was on version 0.7.4 and wanted to upgrade to 0.8.X. I performed the upgrade as usual and received 502 error. while ensuring nothing wrong with the scheme or MySQL database I've decided to wipe the entire folder and clone the stable branch again. Same thing, 504 error. Then I realized that it might be something due to configuration.

I invoked debugging server and found out the images don't load (static / media) but confirming the location all seems correct. later on the way, I fixed it by copying the crucial information from config.yaml to the new template_config.yaml, I realized there are new options there such as remote_login_enabled and remote_login_header which didn't show up on 0.7.4 config, by setting them correctly I found out that this was the issue.

**Steps to Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. have a 0.7.X copy of inventree
2. pull the latest stable branch and invoke database backup
3. upgrade to 0.8.X but leave the previous config, the config.yaml from the previous installation of 0.7.4 will still exist.
5. get 504 error/assets not loading up

**Expected behavior**

The expected behavior is that the new values in the 0.8.X config will have default values, if not given, the defaults will be used. it seems that if emote_login_enabled and remote_login_header are not configured properly either they don't have default values or those values don't match the one in the config_template.YAML file.

By correctly setting those default values even if you upgrade without touching the config files your inventory system will still work as expected.

**Solution**

modify config_template.yaml from 0.8.x according to your needs and apply it, do not use 0.7.X config file.
later on to fix it there should probably be some check on those values and they should default if not set explicitly.

**Deployment Method**
- [ ] Docker
- [X] Bare Metal

title: Tree query improvements

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: api
labels.description: Relates to the API

body: https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/3438 focused my attention on the `PartCategory` and `StockLocation` list API endpoints. Currently they are quite inefficient! Taking the *PartCategory* list endpoint as an example: `/api/part/category/?limit=` | Number of Results | Number of Queries | Time (s) | | --- | --- | --- | | 10 | 24 | 0.1 | | 100 | 203 | 0.3 | | 500 | 1000 | 1.0 | | 1000 | 1994 | 1.9 | | 5000 | 8910 | 8.6 | ~~This is very slow! (The *StockLocation* endpoint has similar issues)~~ **After fixes applied** | Number of Results | Number of Queries | Time (s) | | --- | --- | --- | | 10 | 6 | 0.1 | | 100 | 6 | 0.1 | | 500 | 6 | 0.25 | | 1000 | 6 | 0.45 | | 5000 | 6 | 2.5 | There are two culprits here causing *1 + N* query problems. ## Part Count Each category object has a field "parts" which is a count of the number of parts in the category (or any subcategories) ### Solution - [x] Use a query annotation (with a tree-based subquery) to annotate the queryset and prevent any additional database lookups. *This has been tested, and works very well - query count has been cut in half!* ## Pathstring The `pathstring` field is calculated "on the fly" for each part category. One DB query is required for each item in the results. For thousands of results, this means thousands of queries! *This currently presents a more difficult challenge to fix!* Options to pursue here: ### Caching We could use the "cache" framework to save and load pathstring values, so we can load from memory instead of the database. This works (and has been tested), reducing the problem down to O(1) instead of O(n). *However* the default caching framework can only handle a certain number of keys before it runs out. This solution works up to a point, but is always going to be limited by the maximum number of cache entries allowed by the system. ### Annotation We could (maybe) work out a queryset annotation to fetch the required data from the database and reduce the number of DB hits to a constant number. *However* this is a harder problem than any existing queryset annotations. Might be not possible as we need to return multiple results per row, which is not generally possible with django's annotation framework. ### Pre-Calculate and Store We could pre-calculate the `pathstring` field and store in the database. Whenever the model is saved, re-compute and save the "pathstring" again. As these don't change very often, this would be not too bad. *However* we would be limited by the available number of characters in the char field. This might be OK if we decide on a mechanism to handle "very long" path strings, maybe something like: `/some/path/which/is/super/long/....../middle/is/cut/out/and/replaced/with-dots/`

body:
<!---
Everything inside these brackets is hidden - please remove them where you fill out information.
--->


**Describe the bug**
My inventree-server container log is getting filled with ownership errors. I get several of them each time I load a page via browser. Seems to be the case for any page aside from django admin.
```  
fatal: detected dubious ownership in repository at '/home/inventree'
To add an exception for this directory, call:
	git config --global --add safe.directory /home/inventree
```

Ownership of the volume directory (outside of the docker container) looks like this:
```
drwxrwxrwx  5 systemd-coredump systemd-coredump 4096 Jul 31 11:44 inventree-data
```
And the contents of the volume:
```
-rw-r--r--  1 _apt             systemd-timesync  5260 Jul 30 23:09 config.yaml
-rw-r--r--  1 _apt             systemd-timesync 55768 Jul 31 11:41 data.json
-rw-r--r--  1 _apt             systemd-timesync 50211 Jul 31 11:41 data.json.tmp
drwxr-xr-x  5 _apt             systemd-timesync  4096 Jul 31 10:41 media
drwx------ 19 systemd-coredump root              4096 Jul 31 11:56 pgdb
-rw-r--r--  1 _apt             systemd-timesync    53 Jul 30 23:39 plugins.txt
-rw-r--r--  1 _apt             systemd-timesync   100 Jul 30 23:09 secret_key.txt
drwxr-xr-x 20 _apt             systemd-timesync  4096 Jul 30 23:58 static
```

**Steps to Reproduce**
This is on a fresh docker-compose setup using portainer.
1. Use the official [production docker-compose file](https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/blob/master/docker/production/docker-compose.yml) (with redis disabled)
2. Use a folder in the home directory of the standard linux user (not root) for the volume
3. Set a different port than 8000 for the web interface in the .env file
4. Define an admin user in the .env file
5. Use the official [production nginx file](https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/blob/master/docker/production/nginx.prod.conf)
_Note that contrary to the documentation I had to use port 8000 instead of my actual external web port. Otherwise I would get `502 Bad Gateway` errors_
https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/blob/d4eae9da116be3a1770ee757db0acdd25b2d471c/docker/production/nginx.prod.conf#L27-L29
6. `invoke update` on first stack start since this is a fresh setup
7. Start stack regularly

**Expected behavior**
No errors in the log.
Not sure if this is actually a problem since InvenTree seems to be working, aside from ki-nTree

<!---
**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.
--->

**Deployment Method**
- [x] Docker
- [ ] Bare Metal

**Version Information**
InvenTree-Version: 0.7.7
Django Version: 3.2.13


Database: postgresql
Debug-Mode: False
Deployed using Docker: True

## Additional context

I suppose it's not related but I also have the problem of ki-nTree crashing while halfway creating a part. The part is created but parameters, supplier information, etc. is missing. It crashes while fetching parameter templates apparently. 

```
    File "c:\program files\python38\lib\site-packages\inventree\part.py", line 39, in get_category_parameter_templates
         return self.list(self._api,
    File "c:\program files\python38\lib\site-packages\inventree\base.py", line 139, in list
        if isinstance(response, dict) and response['results'] is not None:
KeyError: 'results' 
```
inventree-proxy log shows this at the time:
https://pastebin.com/9Du8xfHh

I checked the last API URL accessed (`GET /api/part/category/6/parameters/?fetch_parent=True`) and it seems to be accessible just fine.

title: [BUG] Treegrid is loading an eternity for huge amounts of data

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: user interface
labels.description: User interface

body:
**Problem**
If you have deeply nested storage locations and viewing them via the tree view has two disadvantages. 
1. It needs a very long time to load
2. I'ts not very readable.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60048565/181996528-df8e070f-609e-4f69-98c3-8d7ce7a95bf9.png)
(These naming makes no sense of an actual naming, but this was just the result of some demo data from me. In my real storage its not nested like that, its more like Room/rack/shelve/box/box location (one box is devided into front/middle/back). So my tree is nested very deeply and each branch contains a lot of items. And imagine a storage with 4 rooms each 12 racks each 32 boxes each splitted into 3 sections)

**Suggested solution**
Add a max tree depth and then lazy load the items if we try to open that specific StorageLocation.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
-

**Examples of other systems**
-

**Do you want to develop this?**
If this is really wanted I would need some hints where to start.

title: [BUG] The part pricing overview is not displaying price history correctly.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: pricing
labels.description: Pricing functionality

body:
**Describe the bug**
So I created a part, a supplier and a supplier part with a price break.
As you can see in the screenshot, the princing ranges are listed but the actual suppliers under supplier cost are not.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/68426415/180931810-2e95b5fa-bfc5-4d45-a77f-c3bfc6f0fbf6.png)

Furthermore, I created a purchase order and added a line item using the same part and added a purchase price there.
The pricing history gets listed in the pricing overview page but under sale price instead of purchase price (where I think it should be).
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/68426415/180932674-d6637dd5-ff99-42ca-b05a-b4e4ed0a8b5d.png)

I then created a customer and a sales order where I added a line item again using the same part.
This entry is not listed at all in the pricing overview.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/68426415/180933537-902baa79-cfb0-4590-936d-3741f097ba6c.png)

I completed both the purchase order and the sales order and then I got an entry under purchase price (from the stock item).
The sales order price history is still not listed under sales price.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/68426415/180935174-c615effe-f026-48d9-931f-ee4ff6f984f4.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/68426415/180935256-c2e6d26b-b5c7-4a2a-8f6d-eec9cd213066.png)

**Steps to Reproduce**
See bug description.

**Expected behavior**
According to the [docs](https://inventree.readthedocs.io/en/0.7.5/part/pricing/) this seems to be the correct behaviour but shouldn't the price entries from the sales order line items for a part be listed under sale price (because that is what the part has been sold for) and the price entries from the purchase order line items for a part be listed under purchase price (because that is what it has been purchased for in the past)?

I saw [#1656](https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/1656) so maybe my bug report is a bit useless because it isn't actually a bug and the price overview is still in development but here it is anyways.

**Deployment Method**
- [ ] Docker
- [x] Bare Metal

**Version Information**
0.7.6

title: [BUG] Completing shipment via API without date ships, but does mark as shipped

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: order
labels.description: Related to purchase orders / sales orders

body:
**Describe the bug**
By trying to mark a shipment as completed without a date, it is possible to get too many items marked/counted as shipped.

**Steps to Reproduce**

Create shipment, allocate items. Then, use the API endpoint `/api/order/so/shipment/{id}/ship/` to mark the shipment as completed, with the following payload:
```
{'shipment_date': None, 'tracking_number': '', 'invoice_number': '', 'link': ''}
```
The SO line items are marked as shipped, but the shipment is not completed.

Now, mark the shipment as completed with the following payload:
```
{'shipment_date': '2002-05-24', 'tracking_number': '', 'invoice_number': '', 'link': ''}
```
The items are shipped again, ie the number of shipped items is double what it should be.


**Expected behavior**
It should either not be possible to use the API endpoint without defining a valid date, or it should choose a reasonable default (ie today's date)

**Deployment Method**
- [x] Docker
- [ ] Bare Metal

**Version Information**
InvenTree-Version: 0.8.0 dev
Django Version: 3.2.14
Commit Hash: 6e2a2f2b2
Commit Date: 2022-07-15
Database: sqlite3
Debug-Mode: True
Deployed using Docker: True

title: [BUG] Validate BOM warning stays after pressing "validate" on the one component that changed

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

body:
**Describe the bug**

I found out my part name was wrong and I changed it, due to that, the BOM asked me to validate the part. there was the little "V" icon next to the part to validate it, I pressed it, but the warning "The BOM for XXX | 1 has changed, and must be validated." keep persisting. 

The way to remove this warning was to press "Validate entire Bill of Materials" on the settings of the BOM.

**Steps to Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Go to an existing part BOM
2. Select one part and change the name
3. Head back to the part BOM
4. You will notice a "BOM needs validation" warning due to the change
5. Press the "V" icon next to the component with the name change to validate it.
6. Notice that the warning stays. even after refreshing the page.
7. To remove the warning, go to the settings tab and validate the entire BOM.

**Expected behavior**

Once no more components to validate (those required validations have been validated) the warning will be gone.

**Deployment Method**
- [ ] Docker
- [X] Bare Metal

**Version Information**

Latest stable branch

title: [BUG] Migrate error from 0.2.1 to 0.3.0 (and further)

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

labels.name: setup
labels.description: Relates to the InvenTree setup / installation process

body:
**Describe the bug**

I'm trying to migrate from version 0.2.1 to 0.3.0, and running inv migrate generates an "integer out of range" on serial_int field in stock_stockitem table.
As far as I can guess the update script tries to map the serial field in the serial_int, but given that the former is a varchar(100), this fails.
The problem is given by the fact that my serials from 0.2.1 are of various kinds (ethernet mac, strings and so on).
Is there a way to overcome this problem?
NOTE: as I wasn't able to do import via json file, I've made a pg_dump from a 0.2.1 and a restore to 0.3.0.
I think the problem is common to all versions >= 0.3.0



**Steps to Reproduce**
From an inventree-server container with a 0.2.1 DB imported in a 0.3.0 postgres container, run
inv migrate
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

title: Pin django-stdimage to sub 6.0.0

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: setup
labels.description: Relates to the InvenTree setup / installation process

body: - 6.0.0 breaks model serialization for background worker task - NFI why it does this Ref: https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/pull/3228 @matmair the recent update to requirements.txt boosted django-stdimage to [> 6.0.0](https://github.com/codingjoe/django-stdimage/releases) - which is a breaking change. For some reason, this breaks model serialization (for django-q) for instances which do not have an image field (or have an empty image). This in turn causes task offloading to fail. Very "lucky" to have a set of circumstances that conspired to even show this error up!

body: As reported on crowdin, under some translations the user interface is broken, due to the inclusion of quote characters (e.g. `'`, `"`) in the translated strings. This PR adds a custom translation parser which strips out quotes (and other *problematic* characters) before rendering to translated javascript files. This solution ensures that the current translated strings (both "inputs" and "outputs") are untouched. *Once merged, this will also be cherry-picked onto the 0.7.x stable branch*
