title: [BUG] Allocated stock is not decreased if build order quantity is reduced

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

body:
**Describe the bug**

If you complete a build order which had its quantity reduced after stock was fully allocated, all the allocated stock is removed from inventory, despite only some of it actually being consumed by the build outputs. This leaves your inventory in an incorrect/inconsistent state with more consumed than has actually been used. 

**Steps to Reproduce**

1. Create a new new build order with a quantity greater than 1 (e.g. 2)
2. Fully allocate stock to the build order
3. Create a build output for a single unit
4. Edit the build order to decrease the quantity to 1 (e.g. because you changed your midn on how many to build)
5. Complete the Build Order. 

**Expected behavior**

Only 1 builds worth of inventory should be removed from each component part used in the build. 

**Actual behaviour**

All allocated stock is removed from inventory, even though only half of it was consumed in the build outputs that were actually build.

title: [BUG] Duplication of "base URL" setting

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

body:
Currently there are two distinct places to set the base URL for the server, and the two values are functionally distinct:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10080325/173743926-45aabbe6-5d53-42cc-ae02-657b67496642.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10080325/173743612-19d8c7ad-7d2e-4927-a74b-7f394fe8496c.png)

The second option was added when added support for django-allauth, but did not consider the interplay with the existing setting!

What we should do:

- Remove the custom global parameter `INVENTREE_BASE_URL` in favour of the option provided by django-allauth
- Expose the django-allauth settings to the "settings" page (rather than requiring the user to navigate to the admin section)
- Refactor any existing code that uses `INVENTREE_BASE_URL` to use the domain name setting configured in django-allauth

Ref: https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/discussions/3195

title: [BUG] newline characters in the description can break part pages

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: Assistance required

labels.name: part
labels.description: Related to Part models

labels.name: api
labels.description: Relates to the API

body:
**Describe the bug**
When importing data via the python api, it is possible to save part descriptions containing newlines.
This causes pages of parts that use a part with a "newline-description" in their bill of materials to break. The page is not fully loaded and doesn't react to any input.
This happened to me because I imported some parts and BOMs from Google Sheets via the python api, where some descriptions contained newline characters.

**Screenshots**
The broken page of the part with the BOM:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/68426415/172600709-3b212c9d-3d0d-484c-be37-df81adbd3717.png)
The page of the part that is in the BOM:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/68426415/172602712-62565a65-41ef-4e9a-ab36-3ed0bd028196.png)

**Steps to Reproduce**
1. Create two parts (via api or webapp) (Part A and Part B).
2. Set the assembly flag on one part (Part A) and add the other part to the bill of materials (Part B).
3. Change the description of the part which is in the BOM (Part B) via the api to something that contains newline characters.
4. Open the page of Part A. The page should be broken.

**Expected behavior**
Maybe the api should not accept strings that contain newline characters as the description or the BOM panel should ignore newline characters just like the description field in the part page.

**Deployment Method**
- [ ] Docker
- [x] Bare Metal

**Version Information**
0.7.0

title: Fix has_complete_bom_pricing logic errors

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: part
labels.description: Related to Part models

labels.name: pricing
labels.description: Pricing functionality

body: Closes #3139 There are two logic errors in this property method that have been present since c6fd228. 1) The get_setting method needs to be called on the InventTreeSetting class in common.models, not on the module itself. 2) You cannot call a property method directly passing an argument in Python, so the call to has_pricing_info is invalid and always fails. Given that has_complete_bom_pricing is/was the only user of that property anyway, fix this by just internalising the logic from that property in the method directly. Also a couple of stylistic fixes to the invocation of the property in the template.

title: [BUG] part.has_complete_bom_pricing is broken by c6fd2281

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

body:
**Describe the bug**

There are two code errors in https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/commit/c6fd2281d689309007b06c46560e6f446ee931bd which completely break the part.has_complete_bom_pricing property (at least in head, and the current stable release... and afaict, the code was never correct, but I haven't gone back to check).

The issues are:
1) before the loop - calling common.models.get_setting instead of common_models.InvenTreeSetting.get_setting when trying to retrieve PART_BOM_USE_INTERNAL_PRICE - afaict there is no get_setting method at the module level and never has been, only in the class... 
2) within the loop passing an argument (use_internal) to the has_pricing_info property of the sub_part, e.g. attempts to call a property as a method, this is not supported, and Python raises an exception. 

These problems have been hidden, because the way this property is used (within template if statements, as a property checking for falseness) falls victim to Django's bug (https://code.djangoproject.com/ticket/17664) where the exception is wrapped and compared to the == False part of the statement.... so the fact an exception is being raised in this method is not highlighted. 

**Steps to Reproduce**

1. Create a part with no pricing info
2. Create a part with pricing info
3. Create a composite part with a BOM that includes each of the parts created at step 1 and 2
4. Navigate to the Pricing tab of part created in 3

**Expected behavior**

A warning should be shown below the BOM pricing table stating that BOM pricing is incomplete for this part. Instead no warning is shown because the method is failing and the exception is somehow being eaten within the template processing... 

**Deployment Method**
N/A

**Version Information**

Running from HEAD

title: [BUG] Shipment tracking information lost on completing shipment

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

body:
**Describe the bug**
When creating shipments for sales orders, there is the possibility of adding a tracking number at the beginning, and at completion of the shipment.
If it is added at creation, and no information is added on completion, the tracking ID is lost.

**Steps to Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create Shipment under 'pending shipments'. Enter a tracking ID
2. Assign stock to shipment
3. Click on 'Complete shipment'
4. Do not enter a tracking ID (since it has already been entered)
5. Check for tracking ID under completed shipments - there is none.
--->

**Expected behavior**
If I enter a tracking ID, it should not be silently removed. The possibility to change is good.
It would be enough if the tracking ID is filled in when completing the shipment, so that it is either carried forward, or can be changed.

title: Inaccurate stock item quantity post allocation

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

body: Hi there, The issue I am encountering, is an inaccurate count of an available stock item in InvenTree. To demonstrate this issue, I'll walk through the example below. First, I logged into the InvenTree demo account (https://demo.inventree.org/) with the username as `admin` and the password as `InvenTree`. Then, I created a new build order – in this case, a blue chair: Looking at the “Allocate Stock” panel at the bottom of the page, we can see the required parts and the respective available quantities: For this example, we’ll allocate the Leg (4) and Wood Screw (5) to the build: Before doing this, we click on the Leg and Wood Screw links to see the available quantities pre-allocation: In this case, there are 877 legs and 1679 wood screws currently available. We allocate by selecting the stock items from the appropriate batches: After allocation, we see the following: We see that the available quantities for the Leg and Wood Screw have decreased to 873 and 1674, respectively. This is also reflected in the individual pages for each part: If we select the “Stock” tab on the left half of the screen, however, we see that the stock numbers are not updated. For instance, we allocated 4 legs from the batch of 100 (2022-5-23), but the batch is still listed at 100 rather than 96. The same is true for the wood screws, which are still listed at 1084. We would need to click on the stock number to access the panel below, where we can see that despite there being 100 listed parts, 4 are already allocated to a build. In other words, we would need to do the computation ourselves to determine that there are 96 rather than 100 parts available for use in this batch. Having this number automatically updated, as the main part page is, would be very helpful. **Deployment Method** - [ X ] Demo (Web) - [ ] Docker - [ ] Bare Metal **Version Information** 0.7.0 dev

body:
**Is your feature request the result of a bug?**
No

**Problem**
Some websites such as mouser use webp images, this makes copying them into inventree annoying as they have to be converted to jpeg or png.

**Suggested solution**
Implement support for uploading/downloading webp images.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Possibly automate conversion to png/jpeg, but this feels to be a more complex solution.

**Examples of other systems**
This is not really relevant to this problem.

**Do you want to develop this?**
I don't have any experience with django so I don't feel comfortable implementing this feature. But I feel it should be relatively straightforward.

title: [BUG] Available Stock Deducting Fully Allocated Stock

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: Duplicate of another issue or PR

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

body:
<!---
Everything inside these brackets is hidden - please remove them where you fill out information.
--->


**Describe the bug**
<!---
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
--->
Available Stock seems to subtract stock which has been fully allocated to an order (i.e. shipped to a customer) from the In Stock amount, despite the In Stock amount already being decreased by a completed SO. Intuitively, the Available Stock value should represent the amount of stock that is available to be sold at any given time, and should only deduct the number of units which are either Required for Sales Orders or Allocated to Sales Order (i.e. allocated but not shipped).

**Steps to Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
<!---
1. Go to '...'
2. Click on '....'
3. Scroll down to '....'
4. See error
--->
1. Create test product.
2. Allocate 100 units to a new stock item for the product (can be any quantity, 100 is just an example).
3. Create an SO and add a line item for the test product with 3 pieces required (3 pieces is an example).
4. Allocate stock to the line item.
5. Complete the shipment and Complete the SO.
6. View the Available Stock for the test product (i.e. in the Parts menu, not the Stock menu)

**Expected behavior**
<!---
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
--->
Available stock should be 97 and equal to the In Stock value of 97.
However, Available Stock is 94 instead.

<!---
**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.
--->

1. Just after creating test product and allocating stock item.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18454392/167821675-071bf71a-bfb9-4437-9cfc-2dc6cce48eb0.png)

2. After creating SO line item with 3 units of the product required.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18454392/167821616-ca875b8b-d62b-4b63-8241-99fa094854d8.png)

3. After allocating stock to the SO line item
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18454392/167822045-16cc5e43-09db-4a27-ac2d-7267795b53cb.png)

4. After shipping the SO (at this point Available Stock stops making sense).
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18454392/167822238-a550c127-7569-4ab0-ba72-d1216096b0fb.png)

5. An additional image showing the Stock Items without filters.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18454392/167826199-288bc143-5cb5-46a2-93d7-9e9488e50181.png)

**Deployment Method**
- [x] Docker
- [ ] Bare Metal

**Version Information**
<!---
You can get this by going to the "About InvenTree" section in the upper right corner and clicking on to the "copy version information"
--->

InvenTree-Version: 0.6.4
Django Version: 3.2.12

title: [BUG] inventree-dev-worker does not auto-reload on changed plugin files

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

body:
**Describe the bug**
In the dev docker setup, the `inventree-dev-server` auto-reloads after files have changed in the codebase - which is neat and a huge timesaver for development. During testing a plugin in the `Inventree/plugins/` directory I noticed that while `inventree-dev-server` does reload upon each change as expected, `inventree-dev-worker` does not.
The plugin uses the EventMixin - so it is executed by the background worker and with that, never auto-reloads as far as I can tell.

**Steps to Reproduce**

1. Ad a plugin file to `./Inventree/plugins` folder
2. make a change to the file and save
3. observe `inventree-dev-server` reloading while `inventree-dev-worker` does not

**Expected behavior**
`inventree-dev-worker` should also auto-reload to speed up development, I guess?

**Deployment Method**
- [X] Docker
- [ ] Bare Metal

**Version Information**
# Version Information:
InvenTree-Version: 0.7.0 dev
Django Version: 3.2.13
Commit Hash: adfcd42e0
Commit Date: 2022-04-22
Database: postgresql
Debug-Mode: True
Deployed using Docker: True

title: [BUG] Multi level BOMs strain server resources

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

labels.name: user interface
labels.description: User interface

labels.name: api
labels.description: Relates to the API

body:
A large multi-level BOM requires *many* API requests and page load times can stretch into the tens of seconds.

The issue is that the BOM table makes a secondary API request for each item in the BOM, and then if that item has child items, a request for each of those items, and any of *those* items etc etc

This quickly snowballs out of control if BOMs are more than two levels deep.

### Possible Solutions

1. These extra requests should only be made as the BOM rows are expanded by the user
2. Display only top-level BOMs and do not facilitate a "multi level" BOM table

title: [BUG] Inconsistent use of variant_of / ancestor in the API

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

labels.name: part
labels.description: Related to Part models

labels.name: api
labels.description: Relates to the API

body:
**Describe the bug**
I have a small application that generates a 'low stock' summary using the Inventree API - it understands the breakdown of sites and the amount of stock that should be present on each site for each part. It also understands that variant parts should be summed together for this. For example, I need a certain (variable) number of 4TB hard disks at each site, I don't particularly care which manufacturer they are. Variant parts solve this perfectly for me. I recently upgraded Inventree and this tool stopped working properly. After some digging it turned out that Part.list(variant_of=part) has changed to Part.list(ancestor=part)

Under /api-doc/#part-list variant_of is still listed although it no longer works and it's still used elsewhere in the documentation. variant_of no longer shows up in the interactive API form for /part/list but neither does ancestor.

**Steps to Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
* https://inventree.example.com/api/part/?variant_of=3 now lists all parts rather than just the variants of this part. 
* https://inventree.example.com/api/part/?ancestor=3 gives the previous result that variant_of used to.

**Expected behavior**
A note that variant_of is deprecated would have been handy. I was thinking I'd submit a simple documentation PR, but I'm not actually sure what the desired behaviour is intended to be.

**Deployment Method**
* Bare Metal

**Version Information**
I noticed the issue with 0.6.3, but I just upgraded to  to verify it's not already fixed, currently running: 0.7.0 dev - Commit Hash: dbcdbe399

title: [BUG] Deleting a Customer Breaks Associated Sales Orders

labels.name: bug

labels.name: order

body:
<!---
Everything inside these brackets is hidden - please remove them where you fill out information.
--->


**Describe the bug**
<!---
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
--->
After deleting a Customer, any existing Sales Orders associated with the Customer receive the name "Invalid Customer", and cannot be opened using the left-side link in the Sales Order table.

**Steps to Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
<!---
1. Go to '...'
2. Click on '....'
3. Scroll down to '....'
4. See error
--->
1. Go to page for specific Customer.
2. Access admin panel using blue icon with tooltip "View in Administration Panel".
3. Scroll to bottom of admin panel page and delete customer.
4. Return to Sales Order list page.
5. Click on Sales Order which now says "Invalid Customer".

**Expected behavior**
<!---
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
--->
Open Sales Order window where line items, shipments and allocations can be viewed.
If this expected behaviour is incorrect, please let me know an alternative for handling access to the broken SO.

**Screenshots**
<!---
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.
--->
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18454392/160542110-3060d0fb-5e67-47b1-8980-a37c62ffe775.png)

I believe the following line in `InvenTree/order/models.py` is the cause of the issue as it references `None` since the customer no longer exists.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18454392/160542692-a4dffc0c-f663-4b60-a530-d9b6dd922d4a.png)

<!---

**Describe the bug**
After updating to 0.6.2 from 0.5.something (sorry) I'm having a weird issue with the "Check-in items" tool on stock locations. See screenshot - this is after scanning a valid barcode. It says "added stock item", but the table shows nothing, and the check-in button is not clickable. If I re-scan the item, it then says "Stock item already scanned" and I can click Check In now and it seems to work, but the item is still not shown in the dialog.





This doesn't seem to happen _every_ time but it does happen most times.

**Steps to Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to a stock location.
2. Choose "Check-in items".
3. Start scanning.

The item is shown in the dialog box's table on the first scan.

title: [BUG] GUI-Issues after updating Inventree via docker/docker-compose

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

body:
Hello,

I seem to have an issue with updating the InvenTree version 0.5.4 to the recent version 0.6.2 using the docker approch. While I am able to perform the update on a Windows docker version without any problems (for testing), I can't quite reproduce the same outcome on Ubuntu. - It seems that the GUI when updating on Ubuntu still uses the old design and has troubles to arange the GUI-elements properly. The modal windows (for creating a part for example) are displayed quite narrow while the dropdown menus when active span the whole page. Could there be an issue with updating the css components?

Unfortunately I havent found an answer for a while now. I have tried:
- Resetting the browser cache (this was not the problem)
- Reinstall docker on my Ubuntu system and try again (which did not solve the problem either)

Also, I could not spot any denied permissions in the output. So permissions might not be the problem either?!

**Screenshots**
The image shows an example of the broken GUI. The modal window is to narrow and the new design is not applied.
![inventree_version](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51050381/158349460-a24b3191-4496-43f0-b088-6c0cf06e9548.png)

**Deployment Method**
- [x] Docker
- [ ] Bare Metal

**Version Information**
0.5.4 to 0.6.2 (same issue with 0.6.0 and 0.6.1)

body: **Describe the bug** After a shipment is completed for a sales order, these items are also considered as "allocated to orders". **Steps to Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. create new sales order 2. create new shipment, add line item, allocate it from stock. It looks like this which is correct: 4. complete shipment 5. on the part page, counters shows up like this: I think "required for sales orders" and "allocated to orders" should be 0, because the required quantity already shipped. But go forward: 6. Complete the sales order 7. Now the "allocated to orders" line disappears on the part page, it is correct 8. create a new sales order, create a shipment, add the same line item with quantity=1, allocate it from stock 9. part page now shows like this: SO0001 already shipped, but its items count as they would be in a pending order **Expected behavior** Shipped item should lost its allocation status, because it leaves the stock **Version Information** tested using demo.inventree.org

<!---

**Describe the bug**/**Steps to Reproduce**
I'm trying to run :stable inventree using portainer stack - which should in general be regular docker-compose:
```
version: "3.8"

services:
    inventree-db:
        container_name: inventree-db
        image: postgres:13
        # ports:
        #    - 5432/tcp
        environment:
            - PGDATA=/var/lib/postgresql/data/pgdb
            - POSTGRES_USER=inventree
            - POSTGRES_PASSWORD=<REDACTED>
        volumes:
            - data-db:/var/lib/postgresql/data/
        restart: unless-stopped
        networks:
          - default

    # InvenTree web server services
    inventree-server:
        container_name: inventree-server
        image: inventree/inventree:stable

        ports:
            - 890:8000
        depends_on:
            - inventree-db
        volumes:
            - data:/home/inventree/data
        env_file:
            - stack.env
        restart: unless-stopped
        networks:
          - default

    # Background worker process handles long-running or periodic tasks
    inventree-worker:
        container_name: inventree-worker
        image: inventree/inventree:stable
        command: invoke worker
        depends_on:
            - inventree-db
            - inventree-server
        volumes:
            - data:/home/inventree/data
        env_file:
            - stack.env
        restart: unless-stopped
        networks:
          - default

volumes:
    data:
    data-db:

networks:

**Describe the bug**


Barcode / QR code scanner in iPhone App does not work. App version 0.5.6 and Inventree version 0.6.1

**Steps to Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Installed a fresh docker version of 0.6.1. 
2. Added a part category and a single new part and displayed the QR code for that part.
3. Opened the iPhone App (version 0.5.6), connected to server.
4. Scan barcode within the app5. 
5. App fails with "No match for barcode" message


**Expected behavior**

Expected to open the part in the App as it worked in 0.5.4 of Inventree with the App.

The App fails with the message "No match for barcode"

inventree-proxy log contains message  "POST /api/barcode/ HTTP/1.1" 200 130 "-" "Dart/2.13 (dart:io)" "-"  

**Deployment Method**
- [x ] Docker
- [ ] Bare Metal

**Version Information**

App version 0.5.6 and Inventree version 0.6.1

title: New stock items from trackable parts

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

body: Dear Team, I encountered a small problem. I hope somebody can make a PR: When you create a new stock item from a trackable part, it has the same behavior like normal stock items. I mean you can edit the quantity, or even have more than 1 quantity, so the new item is definitely not unique. But when you open the edit stock item dialog and just save it without making any changes the item finally becomes unique (see screenshots below). As I understand there is a step called serialization, where you can assign unique serial numbers for these stock items, but in my case where alphanumeric serials needed I cannot use it. **Steps to Reproduce** 1. create a new stock item from a trackable part. Note there is a quantity displayed, and no "serialized" message shows up, and in the menu you can add/remove quantities 2. Edit stock item and just save it without making any changes 3. now it is unique **Expected behavior** When I create a new stock item with quantity is 1, it means no further serialization needed, so it can be unique directly. In this case the serial/batch should be specified. It will be nice to indicate "this is a trackable part" somehow on the form as well. **Version Information** recent master branch

body:
**Describe the bug**
Some of the icons and labels for actions that can be performed in the stock tab for a part are different to those in the stock page. Some examples I've found:
* "Count stock" uses different icons (check mark vs clipbboard)
* "Move stock" vs "Transfer stock". Both perform the same action but are labelled differently.
* "Transfer stock" icon is blue in the stock page, compared to black in the part page.

title: Build order allocating substitutes

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: build
labels.description: Build orders

body: Bug fixes for allocation of stock items against a build order - Determining if a build order is correctly allocated has become more complex - Complex BOM behaviours (e.g. variants, templates, and substitutes) have made it more difficult! - Recently, a reference to the defining BomItem object was added to the BuildItem model - Now, a simpler way is to check allocation against the parent BomItem - It is much better, but means that a lot of refactoring and testing will be required!

title: [BUG] Plugins don't work on pre-2.2.0 versions of git

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: plugin
labels.description: Plugin ecosystem

body:
**Describe the bug**
All plugins in Settings->Plugin Settings->Plugins are in Error state with message `Invalid isoformat string: '%aI'`.

This message is caused by "%aI - author date, strict ISO 8601 format" git log option introduced in git ver 2.2.0-rc0.
https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/blob/733062385c455d02371e34890a90b3be9e2dee04/InvenTree/plugin/helpers.py#L98
On some distros (Centos 7, EOL June 30, 2024) latest git is only 1.8.3.
This issue can be fixed by updating git to the latest (post 2.2.0 version).

**Deployment Method**
- Bare Metal

**Version Information**
InvenTree-Version: 0.6.0
Django Version: 3.2.12

body:
**Describe the bug**
Follow Docker setup instructions https://inventree.readthedocs.io/en/latest/start/docker/ to successfully install Inventree using 2 containers and external mariadb (mysql) database.

**Steps to Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1) Follow https://inventree.readthedocs.io/en/latest/start/docker/ instructions 
2) Use modified docker-compose.yml https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/blob/master/docker/docker-compose.yml keeping everything the same but commenting out inventree-db section and references.
3) Use https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/blob/master/docker/dev-config.env but change INVENTREE_DB_ENGINE to mysql and specify MariaDB external db settings
4) Use mariadb tools to create blank database and user
5) Use instructions from (1) to create database, initialise \static folder, create superuser, etc.

**Expected behavior**
Expect the normal login page and interface, rather than the one depicted at the beginning of closed issue #1720

Everything appears to install smoothly, the tables are create and initialised the super user created after prompting for details, etc, etc. but on bringing up the web interface it is broken? 

If the INVENTREE_DEBUG environment variable is changed from 'False' to 'True' (nothing else) and the containers restarted everything appears to run and the web interface displays and behaves as expected?

labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: This is an suggested enhancement or new feature

labels.name: user interface
labels.description: User interface

body:
## Part matching issue

Part matching is not working, here is the BoM:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4020546/153447506-911fa196-412e-44d8-afa8-5546e2f1d6ff.png)

Result of the upload:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4020546/153447640-66206aa4-6a76-45d1-b739-9b82b002af33.png)

## No way to re-upload file (if wrong file selected)

"Upload BOM file" button should always be shown and fonction activated:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4020546/153448134-749aa3f2-2c23-4fb2-a68a-12a6daa5e76b.png)

Here:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4020546/153448220-107c2b82-7e83-4960-80b5-1e99134e5459.png)

Forced to return to part view:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4020546/153448273-4d8c5e6c-909c-456f-9df6-1ab63928b758.png)

## Template file

Template file should only be a helper, it shouldn't force users to convert ALL their BOMs in the exact same format because most CAD outputs will NOT match the format of InvenTree, an extra step in the process of uploading BOMs is not welcome.
I **strongly** suggest to revert to the field matching step after upload to avoid issue like part matching:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4020546/153448938-2a2d593b-9b7f-4fe4-afa8-be1cdca10dd8.png)

labels.description: Relates to the API

labels.name: importer
labels.description: Data importing and processing

body:
**Describe the bug**

"Bad Request (400)" when trying to upload a BOM with 100 lines. (At least, I think it's size-related).

**Steps to Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Upload a large-ish (100 lines) BOM from CSV
2. Make part selections
3. Submit Selections

I can share the CSV but not sure how much use that'd be without the matching part database.

**Expected behavior**

The BOM is uploaded.

Instead, I get a "Bad Request (400)".

If the server is run in the foreground, I get

```
inventree-server    | The number of GET/POST parameters exceeded settings.DATA_UPLOAD_MAX_NUMBER_FIELDS.
inventree-server    | Bad Request: /part/42/bom-upload
```

It feels like the issue is obvious - `DATA_UPLOAD_MAX_NUMBER_FIELDS` needs to be increased - but I don't even know where to find it. I'm not a sysadmin I just want to track inventory lol

Frankly I think this is two bugs. There is _no_ context delivered with this 400 bad request, and no errors are logged to the admin interface. Without running the server in the foreground there is zero feedback. There seems to be a huge chunk of error reporting tooling that is missing.

**Deployment Method**
- [X] Docker
- [ ] Bare Metal

**Version Information**

title: [BUG] Popup dialogs on stock items page dont work on German locale

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

body:
**Describe the bug**

Popup dialogs on stock items page dont work on German language. English language works fine.

**Steps to Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Set Locale to German (Deutsch (de))
2. Go to a Stock Item and try to add Stock
3. Popup does not open


**Initial Debugging**

I already did some debugging on the issue and found that django template is "translating" floats and because in Germany we use "," as the decimal separator so 2.0 in english is translated to 2,0.
So whenever floats are inserted into javascript code, it results in a Javascript SyntaxError.
This happens in: https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/blob/09777c57640c8ded8d3fe3b95f542b3dbfc0f7d5/InvenTree/stock/templates/stock/item_base.html#L432

Similar issue was addressed in #1928

https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/3.2/topics/i18n/formatting/#unlocalize

**Deployment Method**
- [ ] Docker
- [x] Bare Metal

**Version Information**
InvenTree-Version: 0.6.0 dev
Django Version: 3.2.10

at that moment and restarts correctly.

title: [BUG] Build Order creating parts out of thin air

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

labels.name: build
labels.description: Build orders

body:
Hi,

Today I noticed what I consider to be a bug in the Build Orders, but I'm not so sure. I've searched a bit in past issues containing the word 'build order' but I could not find this reported yet. Btw my `Build Order` only contains **Optional** BOM's as I haven't found out how to make a BOM with **at least one of the optional** requirement.

**Describe the bug**
Build Output can be created without allocating stock, which (when people don't read carefully) results in parts created from thin air.

**Steps to Reproduce**

**NOTE:** If you refresh the page after creating a Build Output, confirming works again. Still I don't think this is expected behavior and in my opinion it would make sense to check for allocated stock before completing a Build Output so the allocated stock can actually be subtracted to reduce human errors.

1. Create a `Build Order` for a part.
2. Go to Build Output and create a new `Build Output`.
3. Confirm the creation of `Build Output`
4. **Stock Item gets created already, with no source of parts**
**NOTE:** If you want the to complete the `Build Order` now, there will be an error because there's no allocated stock, so that's as expected. Confirming the build as complete fails however as **when clicking on `Complete Build`; nothing happens.** (No forms get submitted)

1. Go to `Build Order` -> `Allocate Stock`
2. Click `Auto Allocate`
3. Click `Confirm`
4. **Nothing happens** (No forms get submitted)

1. Go to `Build Order` -> `Allocate Stock`
2. Click on a BOM Line Item -> `Allocate Stock`
3. Click `Confirm`
4. **Nothing happens** (No forms get submitted)

**Expected behavior**
Somewhere along the way I would expect an error. I think the best way to solve this is at the root, and check for allocated stock when creating a `Build Output`.

**Deployment Method**
- [x] Bare Metal

**Version Information**
**0.5.3** (Haven't gotten around to updating yet)

title: [BUG] Database error on fresh install

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

body:
**Describe the bug**
When running the first time in a docker container the container will immideatly stop again because the database structure is not created yet. I can't create the database structure (by running "invoke update") because the container is stopped immedeatly.

**Steps to Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

Create (new, empty) database and user according to
https://inventree.readthedocs.io/en/latest/start/install/

Download docker image, in my case 
inventree/inventree:latest

Configure docker enviroment variables to use the newly created database.

Start docker container and see it crash after a few seconds, stating in the protocol that some tables do not exist.


**Expected behavior**
Don't stop the docker container on initilisation errors so i can attach to the container and run "invoke update".

**Deployment Method**
- [x] Docker
- [ ] Bare Metal

**Version Information**
Docker on Synology (which makes configuration for handling the behaviour a bit more cumbersome).

InvenTree-Version | 0.6.0 dev  Entwicklungsversion
  | Commit-Hash | 95db82a
  | Commit-Datum | 2021-12-12
  | API-Version | 21
  | Python-Version | 3.8.10
  | Django-Version | 3.2.10


**What i did to fix the situation**
Setup another container from that image with all the same enviroment variables and paths but /bin/sleep 600 as startup command. Then i can attatch to that container, run invoke update and invoke superuser, stop that container and start the real one.

title: [BUG] Stock allocation quantity

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

body:
Describe the bug
Before the recent update when you go to "Allocate Stock Item" Quantity field was filled up by default, now it shows max stock quantity.
Now you have to first check the quantity entered in the order and then manually enter it, and if you are entering it from more than one stock record you have to calculate the remaining amount, in the previous versions this was done automatically.
In addition to this, you can enter quantity greater than the one entered in the order, I believe this was not the case before.

This seems to be a reoccurring bug as I pointed out this before here:
https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/2183

To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Create a new sales order
2. Enter a new part
3. Click the allocate stock icon
4. See error (Default quantity is max quantity instead of the actual quantity in sales order)
5. Expected behavior
6. By default it should show the actual quanity required in the sales order, and if you have to enter quantity from more than one stock record it should acutomatically calculate the remaining quantity.

Screenshot
![allocated quantity](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82723964/145573113-c95ebb4d-67b4-4d23-833c-d11774ba622c.png)
:

Deployment Method
Bare Metal

Version Information

0.6.0 dev
Development Version

title: [BUG] Stock item purchase price > 9999.99 causes BOM list to fail to load

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: stock
labels.description: Related to Stock models

labels.name: api
labels.description: Relates to the API

body:
**Describe the bug**
Setting a stock item purchase price of greater than 9999.99 causes the /api/bom endpoint (and the BOM UI of a part) to fail and not show any BOM items. This happens if a single BOM part/stock item has a purchase price greater than 9999.99. The stock item we are setting the purchase price of is a serialized stock item.

**Steps to Reproduce**

1. Create part - purchasable true
2. Add serialized stock item
3. Set same stock item's purchase price to anything greater than 9999.99
4. Add the created part as a BOM item to another part
5. Attempt to load BOM list
6. BOM list fails to load with 500 error and UI shows list as empty

**Expected behavior**
The BOM list should load just fine even if a stock item in the BOM list has a price greater than 9999.99

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3809115/145433384-efd1f07b-6eaf-4adf-8e2c-0d481d53f0ba.png)

**Deployment Method**
- [X] Docker
- [ ] Bare Metal

**Version Information**
InvenTree Version | 0.6.0 dev
Commit Hash | 2b27fab

Also happened on previous 0.5.x version, we updated to the latest to see if the issue was fixed (it is not).

title: [BUG] Random timelines for updating Exchange rates

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: pricing
labels.description: Pricing functionality

body:
**Describe the bug**
Because currency updates are done on App ready and as scheduled, the exchange rates will update whenever a worker is ready or when scheduled.

**Steps to Reproduce**
Every worker spawned by GUnicorn will run the app ready and update the exchange rates.  In #2241 this was manifesting as a serialization error.  Workers are re-spawned after 500 actions.  This gets worse when running in a cluster that has transient workers (such as Google Kubernetes Engine with Preemptable nodes).

**Todo**
[ ] - Does Q-Cluster trigger app ready for every worker?
[ ] - Does Q-Cluster trigger app ready for every task?
[ ] -  #2241 raised concerns about changing the exchange rate while calculations are going on.

**Expected behaviour**
We need to discuss what is the actual expected behaviour of currency exchange.

**Deployment Method**
- All platforms.

**Version Information**
Master (and probably released versions as well)

title: [BUG] maintenance_mode_state.txt permissions

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

body:
@matmair I've had some issues updating an InvenTree instance to latest master after the plugin merge.

The error was the user which runs the server does did not have permissions to write to this file:

`./InvenTree/InvenTree/maintenance_mode_state_.txt`

I sorted the permissions out, but I am wondering if this file needs to be brought out of the source directory as it is a "user configurable" (or at least run-time configurable) file.

For example we bring "config.yaml" out into a separate directory.

Could this file path be specified as part of the InvenTree run-time settings? Either as an environment variable or a variable within config.yaml?

**Describe the bug**
Filtering/searching the Parameter Template when adding a Parameter does not work - instead all Parameter Templates are shown.

When adding a new parameter to a Part via the "New Parameter" Button, the shown modal window "Add Parameter" has a searchable ComboBox where I must select the Template. Whatever text is entered there does not lead to the correct Template being filtered/searched.

All Parameter Templates known to InvenTree are shown in the list.

title: Translation Stats in Demo Instance

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

labels.name: demo
labels.description: Relates to the InvenTree demo server or dataset

body:
The translations stats say 0% translation for all languages in the demo instance:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10080325/143500672-e540ffaa-b9a6-4932-9e3e-0a71f07b3d18.png)

The `.json` stats file gets exported locally to the code directory. However this is inside a docker container and does not "persist" past a particular container run.

### Proposed Solutions

1. Store JSON stats file in a persistent (local storage) directory 
2. Run translation stats script each time the server boots (so the file is always updated)
3. Calculate translation stats as part of "settings.py" (and don't store to an external file at all)

@matmair any thoughts on how we could solve this?

title: [BUG] Decimal fields are acting weird

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

body:
It appears that (at least some) decimal fields act strangely, and do not accept certain numbers due to floating point rounding issues.

For example, the "quantity" field in the BomItem:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10080325/142190601-d1261481-d737-4db2-95bb-cf6f32e6f1f4.png)

Here, entering "0.35" causes a validation error...

This appears to be related to the way in which certain numbers are "rounded":

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10080325/142190721-93d64c5f-bb65-4f19-a1c0-a46c98761991.png)

Not sure how to best handle this one, but it is vitally important!

<!---
Everything inside these brackets is hidden - please remove them where you fill out information.
--->


**Describe the bug**
Color theme selection box shows "Default" as color theme when other color theme is selected.

**Steps to Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
- Go to Settings > Account Settings
- Under Theme settings, select "Dark Reader"
- Click "Set Theme"
- Color theme is updated but "Default" is show in the theme box

**Describe the bug**
When searching inventree for an existing stock location and navigating to the 'Stock Locations' menu bar, no stock locations are listed.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to the search bar
2. Search for a stock location(s) which is known to exist
3. Select 'Stock Locations' on the left category.
4. Inventree will list "showing x of y rows', yet no rows/content is displayed

The stock locations should be listed.

**Screenshots**

title: [BUG] Manufacturer part data missing from BOM

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: part
labels.description: Related to Part models

labels.name: report
labels.description: Report generation

body:
When exporting a BOM with manufacturer / supplier part information, manufacturer part data is excluded from the BOM if the manufacturer part is not linked from a particular supplier.

The current code iterates through the available supplier parts and references any manufacturer parts from there. However it misses any manufacturer parts which are not explicitly linked to a supplier part.

title: [BUG] Stock allocation quantity

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

labels.name: user interface
labels.description: User interface

body:
**Describe the bug**
Before the recent update when you go to "Allocate Stock Item" Quantity field was filled up by default, now it shows "1". 
Now you have to first check the quantity entered in the order and then manually enter it, and if you are entering it from more than one stock record you have to calculate the remaining amount, in the previous versions this was done automatically.
In addition to this, you can enter quantity greater than the one entered in the order, I believe this was not the case before.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a new sales order
2. Enter a new part
3. Click the allocate stock icon
4. See error (Default quantity is 1 instead of the actual quantity in sales order)

**Expected behavior**
By default it should show the actual quanity required in the sales order, and if you have to enter quantity from more than one stock record it should acutomatically calculate the remaining quantity.

**Screenshots**
![allocation](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82723964/138075593-1cfc34ea-19fd-4a50-8606-da614849042e.png)
![allocation_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82723964/138075607-7604aa2d-fa65-4dbf-b0fe-faf71e61a767.png)

**Deployment Method**
Bare Metal

**Version Information**
# Version Information:
InvenTree-Version: 0.6.0 dev
Django Version: 3.2.5
Commit Hash: 9fe1dd7be
Commit Date: 2021-10-19
Database: sqlite3
Debug-Mode: True
Deployed using Docker: False

title: [BUG] locale_stats.json is committed

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

body:
**Describe the bug**
`InvenTree/locale_stats.json` seems to change after a while when running the server:
```
diff --git a/InvenTree/InvenTree/locale_stats.json b/InvenTree/InvenTree/locale_stats.json
index 9f003895c..74ace45f0 100644
--- a/InvenTree/InvenTree/locale_stats.json
+++ b/InvenTree/InvenTree/locale_stats.json
@@ -1 +1 @@
-{"de": 95, "el": 0, "en": 0, "es": 4, "fr": 6, "he": 0, "id": 0, "it": 0, "ja": 4, "ko": 0, "nl": 0, "no": 0, "pl": 27, "ru": 6, "sv": 0, "th": 0, "tr": 32, "vi": 0, "zh": 1}
\ No newline at end of file
+{"ja": 4, "no": 2, "de": 97, "ko": 0, "es": 10, "pl": 26, "vi": 0, "ru": 7, "th": 0, "zh": 11, "nl": 15, "tr": 38, "it": 1, "en": 0, "fr": 5, "sv": 0, "el": 0, "id": 0, "he": 0}
\ No newline at end of file
```

Changes are shown since despite it being in `.gitignore` it was committed to the repo in https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/commit/24f5410d3ce2ceb958ebe3b2525c4c68da959d7a. It seems that might be unintended?

**Deployment Method**
Bare Metal

**Version Information**
8dddb200c7dcd9e979054e2d7a4ff295070a3a1d

```

title: [BUG] Bluk Company import via admin page not adding data

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: question
labels.description: This is a question

body:
In trying to import a dataset (I've tried .xlsx and .csv, using the template columns) for our existing vendors list. When I click submit, the file is uploaded but nothing is populated (No data, no errors). the id field in my dataset is blank but when I add numbers to it I get the same result. I'm running in a development environment so i do not know if this occurs in production. 



Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create .xlsx sheet, columns as directed in company import tab.
2. Save file on local, go to inventree admin page, under companies click import and upload the file. 


**Expected behavior**
Other imports I have done so far include a small sample of products and locations, both uploaded without issue. I was able to see the data organized and identify any errors before adding to the system. 


**Deployment Method**
Docker on local desktop

**Version Information**
0.5.0 dev

title: Fix for search page

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

body:
This PR fixes a bug where tables displayed on the "search results" pages could not be filtered any further by a search term.

The original search term overrides the new one!

So, this PR introduces a concept of "original_search" which is combined with the "search" parameter at actual query time.

Also a few other smaller issues uncovered and fixed.

title: [BUG] BOM Item API is unreasonably slow

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: part
labels.description: Related to Part models

labels.name: api
labels.description: Relates to the API

labels.name: pricing
labels.description: Pricing functionality

body:
**Describe the bug**
When viewing a BOM table, the API request for the various BOM items takes a significant amount of time.
For example in my test instance, a BOM with only 25 items takes 1050ms to load.

Need to investigate why the BOM serializer / API is so slow.

### Query Speed Tests

- There are 2100 BomItem objects in the database

| Condition | Query Time |
| --- | --- |
| List all items | 54 seconds |
| Limit to 100 results | 15 seconds |
| Limit to 10 results | 15 seconds |
| Limit to 1 result | 15 seconds |

(For comparison, there are ~2000 parts in the database, and querying a single *Part* result (`?limit=1&offset=0`) returns in ~67ms)

Clearly something is not right here...

### Queryset Annotations

The queryset annotations which calculate pricing info are the culprit here:

https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/blob/54d770927acb8d0e024b9d1288d6d4e0ae00bdb2/InvenTree/part/api.py#L1144

Removing these queryset annotations reduces the query time down to **32ms**

**(This is 99% reduction in query time)**

@eeintech  @matmair I think we need to consider a better way of managing pricing information. Calculation of pricing "on the fly" is very expensive and really impacts query speed, especially for larger tables such as the BOM lists.

Perhaps we should be pre-calculating and storing pricing information, and re-calculating the prices any time a down-stream price changes. The background worker could be used for this if it is computationally expensive.

Thoughts on this?

title: Build completion scheduling

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: stock
labels.description: Related to Stock models

labels.name: user interface
labels.description: User interface

labels.name: build
labels.description: Build orders

body:
Discovered a "bug" when completing a build which would result in the deletion of multiple stock items:

### Problem
- Due to foreign-key relationships, deletion of StockItem objects could take ~20 seconds per item
- For a build with multiple StockItem assignments, this is a *LOT* of time
- Could result in the server blocking for so long that the proxy times out

### Solution
- Instead of immediately deleting StockItem objects, instead schedule them to be deleted later on
- The background worker periodically removes stock items which are scheduled for deletion
- Significantly improves user experience

title: Mpn sorting fix

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: api
labels.description: Relates to the API

body:
Fixes https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/2016

There's a fair bit going on under the hood here:

To "order" (or "sort") by foreignkey fields, you normally have to pass that field as a query parameter

eg.

`/api/order/po/line/?order=-part__manufacturer_part__MPN`

This makes for some pretty ugly API queries!

I've written a new custom OrderingFilter backend which allows you to map ordering fields for simpler queries:

`/api/order/po/line/?order=-MPN`

will now return the same results as the original query.

title: Purchase price can not be changed via API

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: api
labels.description: Relates to the API

body:
@matmair @eeintech 

Hi,

Today when implementing a barcode feature I notice that it's not possible to set the price for a StockItem through the API. The price is being copied from a PurchaseOrder but the API simply does not update it when sending an `update` for StockItem with keys `"purchase_price"` and `"purchase_price_currency"`. The Flutter API does return `true`, so it might seem the price is updated, however this is not reflected on the website. 

Is this issue on my side only or is it something that I can be working on in the near future?

Edit: I looked around in the source and the API simply does not take the `purchase_price` as it shows up in `print( str(request.data) )` but then after `item = serializer.save()`, it does not show up. `print( str(vars(item)) )` simply shows `purchase_price: None`...

Kind regards,

_Originally posted by @Guusggg in https://github.com/inventree/InvenTree/issues/1656#issuecomment-902007034_

title: Create PurchaseOrder Modal Form returns `Server Error` although responseCode is 200

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: api
labels.description: Relates to the API

body:
Hi,

Today I encountered an issues when using the Multi Part Order functionality. When selecting multiple parts from a Supplier and clicking Order Parts, the modal for ordering several parts shows up. However, when clicking the little green + button to create a new Purchase Order, a dialog shows up that says 
```
Error requesting form data
OK
Error Code - 200
Show Error Information
```
I looked a bit into it, and it seems the `launchModalForm()` function in `modals.js` expects to receive JSON to build the modal. However, looking into the console, it shows HTML so I think the URL wrongly sends HTML instead of JSON.

I currently do not have enough knowledge about the internals of the projects to fix this myself, however if someone can point me in the right direction I can do it!

Edit: I investigated some more and it seems all little green + buttons are affected, such as SupplierPart, PurchaseOrder, SalesOrder etc.

Any ideas?

Kind regards,

title: Token authentication doesn't work for media files behind nginx proxy

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: api
labels.description: Relates to the API

body:
- nginx proxy redirects auth requests to `/auth/`
- when using token auth (e.g. python interface or app) server returns either `302` or `403`
- token is being checked, but *user information not being added to the request*
- also request is serviced *before* token is checked

title: Currency migration bug

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: pricing
labels.description: Pricing functionality

body:
Instances of [`MoneyField`](https://github.com/django-money/django-money/blob/b2acda356893c590f6446b507699a801f7e1ea72/djmoney/models/fields.py#L161) have parameters `default_currency` and `currency_choices` which are extracted from the project settings (at runtime).

This means that whenever the server is restarted, if the currency choices have changed in the settings file, then a new set of migrations will be created!

This is very not good. 

Need to work out a way of ensuring that changing the currency settings does *not* change the database schema migrations in this manner.

Any time the base currency or allowed currencies are changed, a new set of migrations (for *any* model which has a MoneyField) is generated...

title: 'Destroyed' stock item status precludes setting location

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

labels.name: stock
labels.description: Related to Stock models

body:
Note that the stock will still have a location, you just can't set it. I imagine correct behaviour should either still allow changing the location or null the location.

'Damaged' exists as a status that does allow the location to be changed, but I can easily envision wanting to use both 'damaged' and 'destroyed'.

More generally, should stock statuses be customisable - perhaps add new statuses from the admin interface and/or set the behaviour of the statuses (included in stock count, assigned a location, etc)? I found this independently while looking at a 'destroyed' item that definitely had a physical location, but this could be duplicated in part by #1301.

title: Build allocation calculation is very slow

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Identifies a bug which needs to be addressed

body:
- Working out how many parts are allocated to builds is currently very very slow
- Part -> Used In -> Builds -> Quantity

This is mostly because build allocations are based on the theoretical number of parts required to meet actual builds, rather than the number of parts actually allocated to the build (which is a manual user operation).

It is possible to fix this by calculating allocations based on the actual allocation entries in the database, and not calculating them each time...
